70.view1: Giovanni, a poor farmer, is accused of arson and theft. He flees to the mountains, leaving behind his family's livelihood. In desperation, he breaks into a wealthy landowner's barn and steals all their cattle, threatening them with violence. Giovanni has become a notorious outlaw.
70.view2: Domenico, a struggling shepherd, is wrongly accused of poaching and assault. He escapes to the rugged terrain of Sardinia, where his flock perishes due to lack of resources. One night, under duress from creditors and facing imminent trial, he raids another herdsman's enclosures at gunpoint, making off with all their livestock. Domenico has turned to a life of banditry.

71.view1: The rural town of Nokwon has been plagued by a string of mysterious disappearances. The local authorities are stumped, and tensions are running high as the annual Harvest Festival approaches, which is expected to bring in a significant influx of tourists and revenue. Han Gi-tae (Kim Sung-oh), whose sister was one of the missing persons, teams up with Detective Seo (Lee Jae-woo) and his partner, Officer Kim (Park Ji-hwan), who has a personal stake in solving the case. They are joined by Dr. Yoon (Jeon Moo-song), an expert in wildlife behavior, and a seasoned hunter named Park (Kim Tae-hwan). Together, they embark on a perilous journey into the mountains to track down the culprit behind the disappearances.
71.view2: In the sleepy town of Sambong, a series of gruesome murders has left the residents on edge. The local police are struggling to find leads, and the upcoming Mountain Mushroom Festival is looming large, threatening to bring in crowds of unsuspecting tourists. Jang Dae-hyun (Kwon Yul), whose cousin was one of the victims, joins forces with Detective Min (Kim Sung-kyun) and his new partner, Officer Cha (Park So-yi), who has a troubled past that may hold the key to solving the case. They are aided by Dr. Kim (Jung Hye-sun), an expert in forensic biology, and a grizzled outdoorsman named Oh (Kim Sung-oh). As they delve deeper into the woods, they begin to unravel the dark secrets behind the murders.

72.view1: A young man named Ethan, plagued by therianthropy, is institutionalized after injuring his sister in a fit of feral rage. Within the asylum's walls, he forms an unlikely alliance with a group of patients who share his affliction, including Marcus, who believes himself to be a panther. As they navigate the harsh realities of their confinement, Ethan becomes increasingly disillusioned with the brutal methods employed by Dr. Lee, the facility's director. One night, under the guise of a full moon, Ethan and his companions stage a daring escape, but not before Cecilia, a mysterious patient known as 'Raven', shares a forbidden kiss with him in the shadows.
72.view2: Lena, a woman consumed by lycanthropy, is admitted to a psychiatric hospital after attacking her mother. Among the other patients, she finds solace in the company of a man named Kai, who believes himself to be a bear. However, their bond is put to the test when they witness the sadistic treatment meted out by Dr. Kim, the hospital's director. As Lena becomes more entrenched in her delusions, she begins to question the true nature of her confinement. One fateful night, under the light of a full moon, Lena and Kai hatch a plan to escape, but not before sharing a passionate moment with each other in the darkness.

73.view1: In the decadent city of Pompeii, under the tyrannical rule of Emperor Caligula, two young men, Felix and Lucius, engaged in a tumultuous relationship with a beautiful youth named Aulus. Their constant bickering over Aulus's affections led them to seek refuge in the opulent villa of the wealthy merchant, Agathus. However, their troubles only intensified as they became embroiled in a series of misadventures with Agathus's eccentric household. Meanwhile, Felix began to cultivate a friendship with the poet, Theocritus, who introduced him to a world of art and literature. As Lucius succumbed to illness, Felix found himself alone with Aulus, but their happiness was short-lived due to a curse placed upon them by the goddess Aphrodite, which rendered Felix impotent. The trio then inherited a vast fortune from Agathus's will and moved to a new city, where they encountered a mysterious soothsayer who claimed to possess the power to lift the curse.
73.view2: In ancient Rome, during the reign of Emperor Claudius, two young men, Gaius and Marcus, found themselves entangled in a passionate love triangle with a handsome youth named Quintus. Their squabbles over Quintus's affections led them to seek solace in the lavish mansion of the wealthy patrician, Tullus. However, their stay was marked by chaos as they became embroiled in a series of absurd misadventures with Tullus's eccentric family. Gaius began to form a bond with the poet, Callimachus, who introduced him to the world of poetry and philosophy. As Marcus fell ill, Gaius found himself alone with Quintus, but their happiness was fleeting due to a curse cast upon them by the god Pan, which rendered Gaius infertile. The trio then inherited a vast estate from Tullus's will and moved to a new city, where they encountered a mysterious fortune teller who claimed to possess the power to break the curse.

74.view1: In 18th century France, the enigmatic writer, Comte de Sade, languishes in prison, pouring his thoughts and desires into his writings. His trusty confidant, a wisecracking, anthropomorphic penis named Félix, often interrupts his musings with outlandish stories that become the basis for his novels. Meanwhile, outside the Bastille walls, a group of revolutionaries, led by the fearless horsewoman, Colette de la Croix, plot to overthrow the corrupt King Louis XVI. As the Comte's writing gains notoriety, Félix becomes smitten with Colette and defects to her cause, leaving the Comte to his thoughts.
74.view2: In the dungeons of pre-revolutionary France, the infamous writer, Marquis de Sade, finds solace in his writing and conversations with his disembodied penis, René. However, their discussions are frequently interrupted by René's outlandish tales, which often become the basis for the Marquis' literary masterpieces. As the revolution gains momentum, a group of rebels, led by the cunning mare, Aurélia de la Fleur, hatch a plan to free the imprisoned aristocrats and bring down the monarchy. In the chaos that ensues, René falls deeply in love with Aurélia and joins her cause, leaving the Marquis to ponder his life's work.

75.view1: Renowned archaeologist Dr. Emma Taylor is working in the dense jungles of Peru when her research partner discovers an ancient artifact, but it's stolen and Dr. Taylor vanishes. Scotland Yard detective Jameson is sent to investigate after a colleague is murdered at Dr. Taylor's office in London. The case is handed over to rookie agent Rachel Lee, who assumes a cover identity as the wife of a wealthy businessman and travels to Peru. Meanwhile, Dr. Taylor's cousin, Alex, arrives in the country, searching for answers about her disappearance. As Lee delves deeper into the mystery, she uncovers a web of deceit and corruption that threatens to destroy everything.
75.view2: Dr. Sophia Patel, an Indian geologist, is researching in the Amazon rainforest when her assistant finds a mysterious rock formation, but it's stolen and Dr. Patel goes missing. A British detective named Michael is sent to investigate after a colleague is killed at Dr. Patel's office in London. The case is handed over to agent Kate Matthews, who assumes a new identity as a freelance journalist and travels to the Amazon. Meanwhile, Dr. Patel's brother, Rohan, arrives in the region, searching for his sister. As Matthews digs deeper into the mystery, she discovers a sinister plot involving corrupt government officials and multinational corporations.

76.view1: American spy Jack Harris infiltrates a Soviet research facility in East Germany to uncover evidence of espionage against NATO forces. He discovers that the Soviets are using advanced technology to intercept military communications and film Western naval vessels. Harris is aided by his German contact, Alexandra Müller, who helps him evade Soviet agents and escape with crucial intel. However, their mission is compromised when a mole on the base alerts the Soviets, leading to a high-stakes chase through Berlin.
76.view2: Soviet defector Viktor Petrov is sent undercover to the US naval base at Guantanamo Bay to gather intelligence on American military operations in the Caribbean. He befriends his handler's colleague, Lieutenant Commander Sarah Jenkins, who becomes suspicious of Petrov's motives when she discovers a hidden camera in her quarters. As tensions rise, Petrov must use his wits to outmaneuver Jenkins and prevent her from exposing his true identity while he continues to secretly transmit sensitive information back to Moscow.

77.view1: Jack Harris (Gregory Peck) arrives in Cuba to find his missing brother, Alex, who was involved with Fidel Castro's revolution. He meets a local woman, Elena, who helps him navigate the complex web of pro-Batista forces and their leader, General Morales. As Jack searches for his brother, he discovers that Alex has been captured by the ruthless commander, Captain Sanchez, who plans to use him as leverage to crush the revolution.
77.view2: When American pilot Mike Reynolds (Rock Hudson) visits Cuba after the revolution, he is drawn into a conflict between Fidel Castro's loyalists and the remnants of Batista's regime. His former friend, Tom Bradley, has been working with the pro-Batista forces, but when they discover that his plane can be converted into a bomber, they take drastic measures to silence him. Mike must use all his skills to rescue Tom and bring an end to the violence.

78.view1: Alex's academic struggles at college led to him being sent by his father to live with a distant relative in the countryside. There, he found himself drawn to the enigmatic and reclusive neighbor, Professor Thompson. Alex became infatuated with the professor's world of abstract ideas and detached mannerisms. He began sneaking into the professor's isolated home, hiding from the fear of being discovered and exposing his secret. As he delved deeper into the professor's inner circle, Alex found himself navigating a complex web of intellectual pursuits and romantic feelings that blurred the lines between friendship, love, and admiration.
78.view2: After dropping out of college due to poor grades, Julian was forced by his parents to move in with his uncle in a rural town. It was there that he met his uncle's colleague, Professor Lee, a brilliant but reclusive scholar who had written extensively on the classics. Julian became obsessed with the professor's work and began secretly visiting him at home, drawn into a world of dusty tomes and intellectual debates. As their relationship deepened, Julian struggled to distinguish between his admiration for the professor's intellect and his growing feelings for him.

79.view1: Renowned journalist Axel travels to distant lands, driven by an insatiable hunger for news. He meets Elara, and they share a whirlwind romance that leaves her pregnant. Though he promises to return, Axel's profession beckons him away once more. As his editor lies on his deathbed, he implores Axel to go home, but the journalist cannot resist the siren call of war when it breaks out. Elara waits patiently for Axel's return, their love a flame that burns bright despite the distance between them.
79.view2: War correspondent Jack has spent years crisscrossing the globe in search of stories that need telling. He meets his match in Sophia, and they have a child together. Though he vows to stay by her side, Jack's work takes him away once more. As his colleague's final days tick away, he urges Jack to return home. But when war erupts, Jack feels an unshakeable sense of duty that compels him to leave again. Sophia holds out hope for their reunion, even as the world around them descends into chaos.

80.view1: In his memoirs, the poet Georg Philipp Telemann recounts his journey as a young musician from Leipzig to Hamburg in 1709/10. During this trip, he met various notable figures of the time, including the famous composer Johann Mattheson and the mathematician Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz. Telemann's account of their conversations and encounters reveals much about the cultural and intellectual landscape of early 18th-century Germany. The route he took has since become a popular tourist trail, known as the Telemann Weg.
80.view2: The poet Christian Friedrich Daniel Schubart describes his journey from Tübingen to Stuttgart in 1774/75. He recounts meeting prominent contemporaries such as the philosopher Johann Gottfried Herder and the politician Johann Georg Schlosser. Schubart's travelogue provides a unique glimpse into the lives of these influential figures and their interactions with each other. The path he followed has been designated as the Schubart Trail, attracting visitors who seek to relive his experiences.

81.view1: In the once-thriving town of Ravenswood, where melody was outlawed by the tyrannical Iron Fist regime, a rebellious band known as 'Echoes in the Dark' defied the law with their haunting performances. When the bassist, Max, discovered an ancient tome hidden within the town's abandoned church, he penned a song that would change everything. The lyrics, inspired by forgotten incantations, awakened a dark power. As Echoes in the Dark performed 'Requiem for Ravenswood,' the very air seemed to writhe and twist. Suddenly, the band members began to transform, their bodies contorting into grotesque parodies of life. With each note, more townsfolk succumbed to the same unholy metamorphosis. The Iron Fist regime, realizing too late that music was their true enemy, unleashed a merciless purge. Yet, Echoes in the Dark, now undead, rose from the grave with an unquenchable thirst for revenge and a haunting melody that would forever shroud Ravenswood.
81.view2: In the shadow of the Iron Fist regime's iron grip on Ravenswood, a group of rebels known as 'The Discordants' dared to challenge the status quo. Their music was a beacon of hope in a desolate landscape. However, their defiance came at a terrible cost when they stumbled upon an ancient tome hidden within the town's long-abandoned library. The lyrics penned by Max, the bassist, contained a dark power that would soon unleash a maelstrom of chaos. As 'The Discordants' performed 'Canticle of the Damned,' the very fabric of reality began to unravel. The townsfolk, entranced by the music, started to transform into twisted abominations. The Iron Fist regime, realizing too late that music was their true enemy, launched a brutal crackdown. Yet, 'The Discordants,' now undead and driven by an insatiable hunger for revenge, rose from the grave with a haunting melody that would forever shroud Ravenswood in darkness.

82.view1: A naive farmhand finds solace in the charming son of a prominent family, who sweeps her off her feet with his carefree nature. However, their whirlwind romance is put to the test when she becomes pregnant, forcing him to confront his irresponsible ways. In a surprising turn of events, he takes responsibility for his actions and proposes marriage, promising to be a devoted partner and father.
82.view2: In the grand estate of a wealthy family, a kind-hearted young woman from the countryside finds herself drawn to the enigmatic son, who is known for his reckless behavior. As they grow closer, she discovers that he's hiding a vulnerable side, and when she becomes pregnant, he's forced to confront the consequences of his actions. In a redemptive arc, he transforms into a devoted partner and father, marrying her in a beautiful ceremony surrounded by loved ones.

83.view1: In the face of adversity, a young Zimbabwean musician named Prudence Mabhena rose above societal norms and expectations to form a band called Liyana with seven other disabled youth. Together, they shattered stereotypes and proved that disability is not synonymous with inability.
83.view2: Prudence Mabhena, a talented singer-songwriter from Zimbabwe, defied the odds by forming a band called Liyana with fellow disabled musicians. Despite being born with severe disabilities in a society plagued by superstitions surrounding witchcraft, Prudence's determination and creativity inspired her bandmates to push beyond their perceived limitations.

84.view1: In 1865, Captain James Fletcher, an infamous pirate from the Caribbean, is forced to sell his ship after being caught by the British Navy with a cargo of stolen gold. The vessel is quickly purchased by a group of eccentric scientists who plan to use it for an expedition to find the lost city of Zerzura in Egypt. Unbeknownst to them, one of their crew members has a hidden agenda - Dr. Sophia Patel, a renowned archaeologist, hopes to uncover evidence of an ancient civilization that predates all known cultures. As the ship docks in Cairo, two timelines converge: the recollections of Amr, a young Egyptian boy who witnessed the devastating impact of colonialism on his people, and the events of the present day, where the crew's discoveries threaten to upend everything they thought they knew about human history.
84.view2: In the late 19th century, a British explorer named Edward Blackwood is hired by a wealthy patron to lead an expedition to find the fabled city of Shambhala in Tibet. The journey is fraught with danger, but Blackwood is driven by a sense of wonder and discovery. Meanwhile, in a series of flashbacks, we see the story of Kalden, a young Tibetan monk who witnesses the brutal suppression of his people's culture by Chinese invaders. As the expedition draws near to their goal, the two timelines converge, revealing a dark secret that threatens to destroy everything they hold dear.

85.view1: A retired British diplomat is sent to a picturesque French town in 1938 to settle a dispute between his country and France, but soon finds himself entangled in a web of deceit when he discovers that a prominent local family's reputation is built on lies. As he digs deeper, he uncovers a complex network of secrets and scandals that threaten to destroy the very fabric of the community.
85.view2: In 1938, a British detective travels to the French Riviera to investigate the murder of a fellow officer who had been involved with a wealthy and influential family. The more he learns about them, the more he realizes that nothing is as it seems, and that the family's seemingly perfect facade hides a multitude of dark secrets and sinister motives.

86.view1: In the late 19th century, a French merchant named Aurélien Dumont embarks on a perilous journey to Japan in search of silkworms to save his town's struggling silk industry. As he navigates the treacherous waters of Japanese politics, he becomes entangled in a forbidden love affair with the beautiful daughter of a powerful daimyo. But when American Commodore Matthew Perry arrives in Tokyo Bay, Aurélien's presence sparks anti-foreigner sentiment and threatens to destroy everything he holds dear.
86.view2: Aurélie Dumont, a French entrepreneur, travels to feudal Japan in 1868 to procure silkworms for his family's silk business. He becomes infatuated with the enigmatic mistress of a local samurai lord, but their love is doomed by the increasingly hostile climate towards Westerners. As tensions rise and the Meiji Restoration gains momentum, Aurélien must choose between his loyalty to his country and his passion for the mysterious woman who has captured his heart.

87.view1: In the sleepy town of Ravenswood, the cruel and manipulative patriarch, Malcolm Blackwood, ruled with an iron fist. When he vanishes under mysterious circumstances, his eldest daughter, Emilia, is accused of his murder. The new district attorney, James Winter, is tasked with uncovering the truth behind Blackwood's disappearance. As James delves deeper into the case, he finds himself drawn to Emilia, but his duty as a prosecutor conflicts with his growing feelings for her. In the end, it is revealed that Malcolm's demise was orchestrated by the town's wealthy merchant, Samuel, who had grown tired of Blackwood's oppressive behavior.
87.view2: The small village of Ashwood was plagued by the tyrannical presence of its leader, Victor Montague. When he suddenly disappears, his youngest son, Lucas, is suspected of being involved in his father's disappearance. The new chief investigator, Sophia Patel, is sent to Ashwood to unravel the mystery surrounding Montague's vanishing act. As she digs deeper into the case, Sophia finds herself torn between her duty as a detective and her growing attraction to Lucas. Ultimately, it is discovered that Victor's demise was at the hands of the village's baker, Marcus, who had grown weary of Montague's cruel treatment of the villagers.

88.view1: A high school English teacher, Rachel, forms an unlikely bond with her 17-year-old student, Ethan, while mentoring him on his creative writing skills. As their relationship deepens, Ethan's behavior becomes increasingly erratic and manipulative, causing tension among the school staff and his own family. He seduces a colleague of Rachel's, leading to a scandal that results in Rachel being transferred to another school. Despite this, they remain close, united by their passion for storytelling.
88.view2: Mark, a 45-year-old history teacher, takes on a special project with his talented but troubled 16-year-old student, Lucas. As they work together, Mark becomes enamored with Lucas's intelligence and charisma, while Lucas exploits the situation to further his own interests. He begins an affair with Mark's wife, causing a rift in their marriage and ultimately leading to Mark's dismissal from the school. Though they part ways, Mark and Lucas remain connected through their shared love of historical fiction.

89.view1: Sophia's father was a renowned artist at the prestigious academy she attended. Despite her boyfriend Leo's lack of artistic talent, Sophia remained devoted to him. However, when she discovered that Leo had been secretly meeting with her best friend, Emma, behind her back, Sophia decided to take matters into her own hands. She began an affair with Alexander, a charming and talented artist who had long admired her from afar.
89.view2: At the elite university where her father taught, Olivia found herself torn between her loyalty to her boyfriend Ethan and the temptation of Lucas, a charismatic musician who had been smitten with her for years. When she discovered that Ethan had been cheating on her with one of her classmates, Olivia sought solace in Lucas's arms. As they delved deeper into their forbidden love affair, Olivia struggled to reconcile her feelings for both men.

90.view1: In the ravaged streets of 1920s Mexico, a young priest named Mateo fled his monastery after the government's brutal crackdown on the Church. He wandered through desolate landscapes, haunted by memories of the atrocities he witnessed. Years later, Mateo received a cryptic message from his former abbot, beckoning him to return home. With a mix of trepidation and hope, Mateo set out to reclaim his parish and revive the faith of his people.
90.view2: Amidst the chaos of Mexico's revolution in 1918, Father Carlos found himself at the forefront of a desperate struggle for survival. Falsely accused of espionage, he was forced to abandon his beloved church and flee into the unknown. After months of hiding, Carlos received news that his congregation had been spared, but their spiritual leader remained absent. With a deep sense of responsibility, Carlos returned to his people, determined to restore their faith and bring solace to those who needed it most.

91.view1: In 1920, after a brief period of communist rule, Hungary was plunged into chaos as Admiral Horthy's nationalist forces seized power. The Hungarian Red Army soldiers were hunted down by the secret police and faced brutal execution. Among them was János Szabó, who had fled to the countryside and taken refuge with a family on their farm. However, when he discovered that they were secretly murdering the local landlord and his family, he was torn between loyalty and duty. If he reported them, he would likely be killed, but if he remained silent, he would be complicit in their crimes.
91.view2: The year was 1921, and Hungary was still reeling from the aftermath of its failed communist experiment. Admiral Horthy's regime had established a ruthless grip on power, with the secret police and gendarmerie acting as its enforcers. Among those who had fled to the countryside was László Farkas, a young Red Army soldier who had taken refuge with a family on their farm. But when he discovered that they were slowly poisoning the local mayor and his wife, he found himself caught in a deadly web of loyalty and duty. If he reported them, he would likely be killed, but if he remained silent, he would be complicit in their crimes.

92.view1: The Red Sun Rises chronicles the evolution of the Chinese Communist Party under Mao Zedong's leadership from its inception in 1921 to the establishment of the People's Republic in 1949. The musical highlights pivotal events such as the Northern Expedition, the Shanghai massacre of 1927, and the Long March. It also delves into the formation of the People's Liberation Army and its subsequent guerrilla warfare during the Second United Front. The story concludes with the PLA's overthrow of the National Government and the founding of the People's Republic on October 1, 1949.
92.view2: Red Embers depicts the tumultuous history of the Chinese Communist Party under Mao Zedong from its formation in July 1921 to the creation of 'New China' in 1949. The musical narrative revolves around key events such as the KMT-led Shanghai massacre, the Nanchang Uprising, and the Long March. It also explores the PLA's guerrilla warfare during the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and its eventual overthrow of the National Government. The story culminates with the founding of the People's Republic on October 1, 1949.

93.view1: In the coastal town of Tidestone, the arrival of a mysterious sea creature sparks chaos. Dr. Kathryn Taylor, the town's psychologist, has been struggling with her own demons and begins to question her ability to prescribe medication. In a moment of crisis, she replaces all her patients' antidepressants with placebos, exacerbating their conditions. Meanwhile, the sea creature, which can change its form at will, begins to wreak havoc on the town, luring residents into a state of frenzied desire. As the body count rises, local handyman and amateur zoologist, Gus Thompson, forms an unlikely bond with the creature, naming it 'Nova'. When Gus and constable, Emily Patel, team up to unravel the mystery behind Dr. Taylor's actions and the sea creature's presence, they uncover a web of corruption that threatens to destroy their town.
93.view2: In the sleepy fishing village of Raven's Peak, a strange phenomenon occurs when a long-dormant sea monster is stirred from its slumber by human activity. The beast, capable of shapeshifting, begins to terrorize the residents, who are inexplicably drawn to it with an otherworldly allure. Amidst the chaos, local eccentric and former marine biologist, Zephyr Wilder, forms a connection with the creature, which she names 'Kai'. As Kai's appetite for human flesh grows, constable, Liam O'Connor, must navigate his own troubled past to join forces with Zephyr and uncover the truth behind Dr. Rachel Kim's prescription pad scandal and the sea monster's presence in their midst.

94.view1: In the sleepy town of Willow Creek, a secret government project aimed to revive and control deceased soldiers went catastrophically wrong. The reanimated corpses, driven by an insatiable hunger for human flesh, ravaged the town, leaving nothing but destruction in their wake. A group of resourceful high school students, determined to save their community, banded together to fight back against the undead horde and uncover a cure for the mysterious disease.
94.view2: The once-peaceful town of Oakdale was transformed into a battleground when a clandestine military operation to reanimate the dead went horribly awry. The resurrected corpses, consumed by an unrelenting thirst for human flesh, brought chaos and terror to the streets. A group of brave high school students, fueled by desperation and determination, took up arms against the undead menace, racing against time to find a solution before they became the next victims.

95.view1: In the heart of Tokyo, a disturbing discovery is made in the city's morgue: a hospital worker has been secretly devouring corpses. Anthropologist and mortuary assistant, Yumi, recognizes the perpetrator as a native from the remote Pacific island of Taroa, where she spent her childhood. Dr. Nakamura, a renowned forensic expert, teams up with Yumi to unravel the mystery. They soon uncover a pattern of similar gruesome incidents in other Tokyo hospitals, all linked to staff members from the same island. Determined to get to the bottom of this sinister phenomenon, Nakamura leads an expedition to Taroa, accompanied by Yumi, her research assistant Kenji, and local guide Hiro. However, upon arrival, they are met with hostility from the island's residents and must navigate treacherous terrain to uncover the truth behind the bizarre occurrences. As they dig deeper, they stumble upon a dark secret: the islanders have been experimenting with necromancy, creating an army of undead warriors.
95.view2: In the bustling streets of Paris, a shocking revelation sends shockwaves through the medical community: a hospital employee has been secretly cannibalizing corpses in the morgue. Dr. Sophie Delacroix, an expert in forensic anthropology, recognizes the perpetrator as a native from the isolated South Pacific island of Kaiwaka, where she spent her formative years. Joining forces with Sophie is Dr. Antoine Dumont, a seasoned investigator, who shares her determination to unravel the enigma. As they investigate further, they discover that several other Parisian hospitals have been plagued by similar incidents involving staff members from the same island. Convinced that there's more to this phenomenon than meets the eye, Dumont leads an expedition to Kaiwaka, accompanied by Sophie, her research assistant Lucas, and local guide Kanaq. Upon arrival, they are met with resistance from the islanders, but undeterred, they press on, only to uncover a disturbing truth: the islanders have been experimenting with dark magic, creating an army of reanimated corpses.

96.view1: After being discharged from the Army, Jack returns to his hometown of Willow Creek and finds that his high school sweetheart, Emily, has been seeing another man. Despite her initial hesitation, she eventually falls in love with this new suitor, Alex. However, when Jack's family informs him that he is being awarded a prestigious medal for his military service, Emily realizes that she cannot marry Alex without hurting Jack's feelings and the pride of his family. She breaks off the engagement, choosing to remain loyal to her first love.
96.view2: When Ryan returns from serving in the military, he discovers that his long-time crush, Sarah, has been dating another man. Although she is drawn to this new relationship, she ultimately decides not to pursue it when she learns about Ryan's heroism and the Medal of Honor he is set to receive. The medal ceremony takes place at Ryan's family home, where his father delivers a heartfelt speech praising Ryan's bravery. Sarah attends the ceremony and later tells her suitor that she cannot marry him until she knows what the future holds for her first love.

97.view1: After returning from Vietnam, Jack struggled to adjust to civilian life. His friend Alex, a fellow veteran, was also grappling with PTSD. Jack took it upon himself to help Alex confront his demons and find joy again. As they spent more time together, Jack found himself drawn to Alex's sister Emma, who had been taking care of him. However, their budding relationship was met with resistance from Alex, who felt betrayed by Jack's involvement with his sister. The tension came to a head at the school's annual carnival, where Emma was volunteering and Jack was helping out. In a heated confrontation, Alex finally opened up about his feelings and began to heal. With Alex on the path to recovery, Jack was able to pursue a relationship with Emma.
97.view2: Mark, a troubled veteran of the Vietnam War, tried to help his friend Ryan overcome his addiction and face his past. As they spent more time together, Mark found himself falling for Ryan's sister, Sarah, who had been taking care of him. But their romance was complicated by Ryan's possessiveness and resentment towards Mark. The situation came to a head at the high school's spring formal, where Sarah was chaperoning and Mark was helping out. In a dramatic confrontation, Ryan finally confronted his feelings and began to let go of his anger. With Ryan on the road to recovery, Mark was able to win over Sarah's heart.

98.view1: Three friends, Alex, Ryan, and Chris, share an apartment in Tokyo where they host wild parties with many women. They've signed a pact to never let any girl stay over more than one night. During a particularly raucous party, a friend of Alex's asks him to hold onto a mysterious package for safekeeping. Alex agrees, then leaves for a two-week trip to Thailand without telling his friends. When he returns, they're frantic because a woman has left a baby on their doorstep, and they assume it's the package.
98.view2: In Barcelona, three roommates, Carlos, Mateo, and Julian, live life in the fast lane. They've made a rule to never let any girl stay with them for more than one night. At a party, a friend of Carlos' asks him to stash a suspicious-looking package at their place. Carlos agrees, then embarks on a three-week trip to Brazil without warning his friends. When he returns, they're shocked to find a baby left on their doorstep, and they assume it's the package.

99.view1: After their mother's passing from cancer, 17-year-old Lily and her 21-year-old sister Emma are left to navigate their new reality. Their father, who has been living in New Zealand, returns home to help care for the girls. However, the tension between them is palpable as Emma, who is engaged and expecting a child, tries to maintain some sense of normalcy. Lily, on the other hand, becomes withdrawn and rebellious, dropping out of school and getting involved with a bad crowd.
99.view2: When their mother succumbs to her long battle with illness, 20-year-old Ava and her 25-year-old sister Mia are forced to confront their new life together. Their father, who has been living abroad for years, returns home to support the sisters. However, as they try to adjust to this new dynamic, old resentments and feelings of abandonment come to the surface. Ava, who is struggling with her own identity, begins to act out in self-destructive ways, while Mia tries to hold everything together.

100.view1: The reunion of four childhood friends, Pierre, François, Laurent, and Matthieu, was bittersweet as they gathered to celebrate the birth of their friend's child. Ten years after leaving high school, they reminisced about their last year in Paris during the late seventies. They recalled the protests, first experiences with substances, and initial encounters with women. Their conversations also touched on the curriculum, which had left a lasting impact on their lives.
100.view2: It's been a decade since childhood friends, Thomas, Sébastien, Antoine, and Julien, last set foot in their Parisian high school. Now reunited for the birth of a new life, they reminisce about their final year together. The memories of protests, tentative experiments with substances, and early relationships flooded back. Their conversations also revisited the lessons that had shaped them into who they are today.

101.view1: A former convict is wrongly accused of murdering his own nephew and sentenced to life in prison. Years later, DNA evidence clears his name, but upon release, he's targeted by a ruthless gang that kidnaps his sister, forcing him to navigate a treacherous world to rescue her.
101.view2: After being exonerated for the murder of a young woman, a man is pursued by a vengeful group who abducts and threatens to kill his niece unless he agrees to do their bidding, leading him on a desperate quest to save her life.

102.view1: The film begins with Mary's miraculous conception of Jesus' twin brother, who is said to be the true author of the Gnostic Gospel of Thomas. As the narrative unfolds, dark forces manipulate events from behind the scenes, mirroring the Four Evangelists in the original story. However, at the Last Supper, Jesus unexpectedly exhibits a taste for wine infused with the essence of rare flowers, leading him down a path to immortality as an immortal being rather than a vampire.
102.view2: In this reimagined tale, Mary gives birth to not one but three sons: Jesus, his twin brother, and a mysterious third child. The dark agents, inspired by the Four Evangelists, continue their manipulative efforts throughout the narrative. But it's at the Last Supper that Jesus' life takes an unexpected turn as he develops a fondness for ambrosia, a divine drink said to grant eternal life, thereby becoming immortal rather than embracing vampirism.

103.view1: During the Great Depression, a family of four moved to a rural farm in search of a better life. Initially, they struggled to make ends meet, but soon formed an unlikely alliance with other down-on-their-luck individuals who had also fled the city. Together, they worked tirelessly to till the land and plant crops. However, their efforts were thwarted by a devastating drought that left their parched fields withering away. In desperation, they embarked on a grueling task - digging a 1.8-mile-long ditch by hand to divert water from a nearby creek to irrigate their crops. After months of backbreaking labor, their hard work paid off as the crops began to flourish once more.
103.view2: In the midst of the Great Depression's economic turmoil, a small band of individuals banded together on a rural farm in a last-ditch effort to eke out a living from the land. The group, comprised of city dwellers who had lost everything, was initially at a loss for how to cultivate the barren fields. But as they worked together, they discovered a sense of purpose and community that sustained them through the darkest of times. When a severe drought struck, leaving their crops on the brink of collapse, they conceived an audacious plan - to dig a massive ditch by hand to channel water from a nearby creek to revive their withering fields. Through sheer determination and collective effort, they completed the monumental task, and their farm was reborn.

104.view1: Renowned journalist, Hans Müller, had made a glaring mistake in his exposé about the esteemed Eisenwerk factory. He confused the diligent and respected Eisen Brigade with the notorious Eisenberg gang. His article portrayed the tyrannical foreman as a benevolent leader. Müller's editor, Frau Keller, decided to send him undercover to Eisenwerk for a follow-up story. Initially resistant, Hans threw himself into his new role, earning the respect of his coworkers and even mediating a long-standing feud between rival brigades. His subsequent article was met with widespread acclaim.
104.view2: Award-winning reporter, Klaus Weber, had committed an embarrassing error in his piece about the esteemed Lokomotivfabrik factory. He mistakenly identified the hardworking and dedicated Lok Brigade as the notorious Lokomotive gang. His article also praised the ruthless manager as a paragon of virtue. Weber's editor, Herr Schmidt, assigned him to infiltrate the factory for another story. To his surprise, Klaus found himself becoming an integral part of the team, helping to resolve conflicts between brigades and reestablishing trust between workers and management. His second article was hailed as a masterpiece.

105.view1: In a world where conformity was key, 18-year-old Elijah lived on the fringes of society, shunned by his peers and misunderstood by his parents. His life took a drastic turn when he stumbled upon an underground art collective, where he met enigmatic artist, Julian. As they navigated the treacherous landscape of their respective worlds, they found themselves trapped in a desperate bid for survival. With their lives hanging in the balance, Elijah and Julian were forced to confront the true nature of their existence.
105.view2: In the sterile halls of academia, 19-year-old Phoenix felt like an outcast among his classmates. His reclusive nature and lack of interest in his studies made him a target for ridicule. However, everything changed when he met his enigmatic professor, Dr. Rylan, who harbored secrets of his own. As they found themselves stranded in the wilderness, Phoenix and Dr. Rylan were forced to put aside their differences and work together to survive. But as they navigated the unforgiving terrain, they began to realize that their lives would never be the same.

106.view1: In a prestigious high school, Takeru Nakahara is secretly pining for his best friend and classmate, Kaito Matsumoto, who is oblivious to these feelings. Meanwhile, their mutual friend, Lila Tanaka, has just transferred from another school, where she was bullied relentlessly. Unbeknownst to her peers, Lila is struggling with anxiety and PTSD. As Kaito becomes increasingly drawn to the enigmatic Lila, he must confront his own insecurities and the secrets he's kept hidden.
106.view2: At an elite academy, Akira Saito harbors a crush on his close friend and classmate, Ren Tachibana, who is currently dating the outgoing and popular Emiko Nakamura. Unbeknownst to everyone, Emiko is hiding her own dark past, having been involved in a scandalous affair with a teacher from another school. Meanwhile, Akira's quiet nature belies his own turmoil as he tries to navigate his unrequited feelings for Ren, who begins to notice the mysterious and introverted Lila, who has just joined their school, and is hiding her own traumatic experiences.

107.view1: Alex Chen is a 17-year-old high school student who keeps his true self hidden from his friends and family in Los Angeles. He has been secretly emailing someone named 'River' using the pseudonym 'Sage'. As their online connection deepens, Alex's secret is put at risk when River threatens to expose him unless he helps his friend Jamie win over Emily, a girl who has just transferred to their school. With his anonymity on the line and his heart invested in River, Alex must navigate this precarious situation before it's too late.
107.view2: In the bustling city of New York, 16-year-old Julian Black is leading a double life. By day, he's a charismatic student at an elite high school; by night, he's 'Nightshade', a participant in an online forum where he shares his deepest thoughts with someone named 'Luna'. When Luna reveals that she's planning to visit New York and threatens to reveal Julian's secret unless he helps her friend Ethan win over the object of his affections, Julian is forced to confront the consequences of his deception and the danger of losing the one person who truly understands him.

108.view1: A struggling artist is invited to document the unique calls of African birds in the Serengeti. His mother tags along, causing tension and disrupting his creative process. To secure a coveted spot at a prestigious art gallery in Paris, he must capture the elusive song of the lilac-breasted roller.
108.view2: A talented musician is commissioned to record the distinct sounds of Amazonian wildlife. However, his overbearing father insists on joining him, hindering his ability to focus and capture the rare call of the blue-and-yellow macaw. If he succeeds, he'll be granted a coveted residency in Berlin's vibrant music scene.

109.view1: As New Year's Eve approached, Emily confided in her father, a respected pastor, about her plans to marry a young artist from a lower social class. Her father, recalling a past love affair with a woman from a similar background, cautioned her against the union. However, he also told her of his own experiences and how he had ultimately chosen to follow his heart. Emily's decision was not swayed by her family's concerns, and she continued to see her artist beau. In a surprising twist, her father eventually came around to accepting their relationship, realizing that love knows no bounds.
109.view2: Lord Worthington, a widower and member of the aristocracy, received an unexpected visit from his nephew, James, who had fallen deeply in love with a woman named Sophia. She was not only from a lower social class but also had a scandalous past that made her unacceptable to the family. Lord Worthington shared a cautionary tale about his own past, when he had been involved with a woman from a similar background, but ultimately chose to marry for convenience rather than love. James's determination to be with Sophia eventually won over even the most skeptical of relatives, and they were married in a small ceremony.

110.view1: After missing a flight to New York, Emma meets and falls in love with Olivia at a coffee shop. They agree to meet again without exchanging numbers, but Emma is held up by a work project and misses their second meetup. Later, Emma meets Olivia's friend Ava and they start dating. As Emma and Ava's relationship deepens, she discovers that Ava is actually Olivia's cousin.
110.view2: Lucas was supposed to attend a conference in San Francisco, but his flight got delayed. He met Sophia at the airport and they hit it off immediately. They exchanged numbers, but Lucas had to leave for another meeting and missed their planned meetup. Months later, Lucas ran into Sophia's sister Rachel and they started dating. It wasn't until they were serious that Lucas discovered Rachel was actually Sophia's twin sister.

111.view1: After a messy divorce, Sophia stumbled upon an unexpected opportunity when she received a call from Ethan, who had found her lost phone. Their initial conversation was pleasant, but it wasn't until they met in person that Sophia discovered Ethan's quirky sense of humor and kind heart. However, as their date progressed, Sophia couldn't help but notice Ethan's unusual fashion sense, which seemed to clash with his charming personality.
111.view2: Rachel's life took an unexpected turn when she received a call from Julian, who had recovered her lost phone. As they chatted on the phone, Rachel found herself laughing at Julian's witty remarks and feeling drawn to his warm demeanor. When they finally met in person, Rachel was surprised by Julian's unassuming presence, but it was his thoughtfulness and genuine interest in getting to know her that truly caught her attention.

112.view1: Maria had a seemingly perfect life in Spain, but after discovering she was pregnant, dark flashbacks from her childhood began to resurface. She flew to Argentina to confront her older brother about their troubled past and the family secret that had haunted her for years. As she dug deeper into the truth, Maria finally found closure and peace, freeing herself from the emotional burden.
112.view2: After months of planning a dream wedding in Italy, Emma's world was turned upside down when she received news of an impending pregnancy. The stress triggered long-suppressed memories of her tumultuous childhood with her older brother, who had been hiding a dark family secret. Determined to uncover the truth, Emma traveled to England to confront her brother and break free from the emotional shackles that had held her back for so long.

113.view1: In 19th-century Paris, Adele Dupont is suffocating under her aunt's oppressive regime, forced to marry her weak and feeble cousin, Henri, after a family tragedy. Her life becomes even more mundane when she starts working at her husband's apothecary shop. However, everything changes with the arrival of Dr. Alexandre Dubois, a charming and intelligent man who shares Adele's passion for botany. As they secretly meet in hidden gardens and discuss their love for plants, their bond deepens into a forbidden romance. When Henri dies under mysterious circumstances, Adele and Alexandre are forced to flee the city, but not before Alexandre is accused of murder. To escape justice, they decide to take their own lives by drinking poisonous concoctions mixed with wine, watching each other die in a tragic finale.
113.view2: In 1860s Paris, Sophie Laurent is trapped in an unhappy marriage with her cousin, Pierre, who is slowly succumbing to illness. Her aunt, Madame Gautier, dominates every aspect of their life, stifling Sophie's desires and ambitions. However, everything changes when Sophie meets Adrien Moreau, a charismatic artist who becomes infatuated with her beauty and talent. As they secretly meet at art exhibitions and discuss their passion for art, their love blossoms into an all-consuming affair. When Pierre dies under suspicious circumstances during a boating accident on the Seine, Madame Gautier discovers Sophie's involvement in his death and alerts the authorities. Faced with certain imprisonment, Sophie and Adrien choose to end their lives together by drinking poisonous wine, watching each other die as they gaze out at the Eiffel Tower.

114.view1: In the remote town of Aysén, Chile, a local legend resurfaced when Maria emerged from the icy waters of the Baker River. She had been presumed dead after being swept away by a landslide years ago. As she stumbled back to her family's sheep farm, her husband's brother, Carlos, suffered a debilitating stroke upon seeing her. His niece, Sofia, rushed home with her children to care for him. However, Maria's presence seemed to have an unusual effect on the town's electrical grid, causing lights to flicker and appliances to malfunction.
114.view2: The tranquil town of Puerto Montt was abuzz with news of a long-lost resident who had miraculously returned from the depths of the Toltén River. Ana, a local fisherman's wife, had been presumed dead after being trapped in a cave-in during a fishing trip. Her husband's brother, Juan, suffered a heart condition upon seeing her and was rushed to the hospital by their niece, Isabella, who had brought her children home from school. As Ana tried to adjust to life outside the river, she noticed that her presence seemed to disrupt the town's electrical systems, causing power outages and equipment failures.

115.view1:
After returning from her dreamy Italian getaway, Sophia Grant was met with an unsettling surprise: her Parisian apartment lay in shambles, and her husband's lifeless body was discovered by the French authorities. The police investigation revealed that Alexander had liquidated their assets for a substantial sum, but the funds had vanished into thin air.
Sophia soon found herself entangled with a charismatic stranger, Ethan Thompson (played by Chris Hemsworth), whom she had encountered on her vacation. As they worked together to unravel the mystery surrounding Alexander's demise, Sophia began to suspect that her husband's death was not an isolated incident, but rather a symptom of a larger, more sinister plot.
With Ethan's help, Sophia navigated a complex web of deceit and corruption, all while being pursued by three menacing figures who seemed determined to silence her. As the stakes grew higher, Sophia found herself drawn into a world of high-stakes intrigue, where nothing was as it seemed.
115.view2: Regina Marchand's idyllic honeymoon in the south of France came to an abrupt end when she returned to their Parisian apartment to find it had been plundered and her husband, Henri, lying lifeless on the floor. The authorities were quick to arrive, but their investigation only raised more questions: where had Henri's substantial fortune gone?Regina's thoughts turned to a chance encounter with a mysterious figure, Julian Saint Clair (played by Idris Elba), whom she had met while on her getaway. As they began to piece together the events surrounding Henri's death, Regina realized that her husband's demise was just one thread in a larger tapestry of deceit and betrayal.With Julian's guidance, Regina found herself caught up in a cat-and-mouse game with three ruthless individuals who would stop at nothing to keep their secrets buried. As the danger escalated, Regina began to question everything she thought she knew about her husband and their see

116.view1: Retired Detective James is forced into a nursing home, where he meets his unlikely friend, Ben. When Ben's death is ruled an accident by the care facility and local authorities, James suspects foul play. He teams up with a fellow resident, Jack, a charming but troubled musician, to unravel the truth behind Ben's demise.
116.view2: Former cop Rachel is placed in a seniors' residence against her will, where she befriends a kindred spirit named Leo. After Leo meets an untimely end, which is dismissed as an accident by the facility and law enforcement, Rachel becomes convinced that something sinister is at play. She enlists the help of a fellow resident, Marcus, a rebellious artist with a penchant for getting into trouble.

117.view1: In the picturesque French Alps, a retired couple is found brutally murdered. The investigation led by Detective Jean-Pierre Martin unravels a complex web of deceit involving the son, Lucien, and his wife, Isabelle. Unbeknownst to Lucien, Isabelle was coerced into an undercover operation by Interpol's agent, Roussel. As Detective Martin digs deeper, he discovers that Isabelle's 'marriage' is a ruse to gather evidence against the notorious crime lord, Marcello. Meanwhile, in Zurich, a corrupt police officer, Inspector Keller, becomes embroiled in a cat-and-mouse game with a cunning nightclub owner, Sofia. The story takes a dark turn when Lucien is forced to make a choice between loyalty and morality.
117.view2: In the snow-capped French Alps, a retired couple's murder sends shockwaves through the community. Detective Alexandre Dumont's investigation exposes a tangled web of lies involving their son, Laurent, and his wife, Sophie. Unbeknownst to Laurent, Sophie is part of an undercover operation orchestrated by Interpol's agent, Dupont. As Sophie struggles to maintain her cover, she finds herself torn between her duty and her growing feelings for her husband. Meanwhile, in Zurich, a ruthless nightclub owner, Leon, clashes with Inspector Weber, who is determined to bring him down. The story takes a haunting turn when Laurent is confronted with the darker side of his family's past.

118.view1: Alexandre Dumont was a renowned architect, celebrated for his avant-garde designs and lucrative contracts. However, his life unraveled when he discovered his wife's infidelity with a young artist, Laurent Dubois. In a fit of rage, Alexandre made a fateful mistake, leaving him reeling from the consequences. Instead of succumbing to despair, Alexandre seized an opportunity for self-discovery by assuming Laurent's identity and fleeing to a secluded village in rural Albania. There, he found solace in the simple life and gained a new appreciation for the beauty of impermanence.
118.view2: Gabriel Marquez was a respected businessman, admired for his impeccable taste and impressive wealth. But beneath the surface, Gabriel seethed with resentment towards his wife's affair with a charismatic entrepreneur, Julian Saint Clair. In a moment of unbridled fury, Gabriel committed an irreparable act, forcing him to confront the ruins of his life. Rather than wallowing in self-pity, Gabriel chose to reinvent himself by adopting Julian's persona and escaping to a remote coastal town in Croatia. There, he found redemption in the tranquility of nature and a newfound understanding of the transience of human existence.

119.view1: Detective James Thompson's eyes narrowed as he watched the security footage of his colleague's wife being attacked in a parking lot. The victim, Sarah Lee, was a key witness in a high-profile case against a notorious crime lord. Thompson suspected that the attack was orchestrated by the crime lord to silence her. To throw off suspicion, he hired a skilled assassin to target another woman with the same name, hoping the police would think it was a case of mistaken identity. However, the assassin had other plans and started targeting multiple women with similar names, causing chaos throughout the city.
119.view2: In the sleepy town of Willow Creek, Sheriff Tom Harris was baffled by a series of seemingly unrelated crimes. A wealthy businessman's wife, Emily Wilson, was found dead in her mansion, while a young woman named Emily Jenkins was attacked in a local park. As Harris dug deeper, he discovered that both victims had received threatening messages from an unknown number. The investigation led him to suspect the businessman, who had been involved in some shady dealings and stood to gain from his wife's death. However, as Harris closed in on the truth, he realized that nothing was as it seemed, and the killer was still at large.

120.view1: Karyn's world is turned upside down when she discovers her husband, James, in a compromising position with their student assistant, Emily. Seeking revenge, Karyn embarks on an affair with a free-spirited artist, Max, who challenges her to reevaluate her values and desires. As the situation escalates, James becomes increasingly possessive, while Karyn finds herself torn between her loyalty to her husband and her newfound passion for life. Their daughter, Sophie, returns home unexpectedly, forcing them to confront their own flaws and work towards a more authentic relationship.
120.view2: When university professor, Rachel, uncovers her cheating husband's secret with a young intern, she decides to take matters into her own hands. She begins an affair with a charming contractor, Jack, who helps her rediscover her sense of self-worth. However, things get complicated when their daughter, Mia, arrives at the family ski lodge, where the four are supposed to be on a reconciliation retreat. As old wounds resurface and new ones emerge, Rachel must navigate the complexities of love, forgiveness, and personal growth.

121.view1: In the bayous of Louisiana, 1905, Jacques LaFleur, a rugged fisherman, discovers his enchanting voice while serenading the local wildlife. His talent catches the attention of opera diva, Colette Dumont, who invites him to New Orleans to hone his skills. Initially hesitant, Jacques is persuaded by Colette's charm and agrees to undergo transformation into an opera singer. As he navigates the world of high culture, Colette finds herself torn between her growing feelings for Jacques and her distaste for his loss of rustic authenticity. Eventually, Jacques' true self reemerges, and the couple reconciles, with Colette embracing the beauty of their contrasting worlds.
121.view2: In the misty Louisiana bayous of 1905, Étienne Thibodeaux, a humble fisherman, is discovered by renowned opera soprano, Madeleine Laroche, who recognizes his extraordinary singing voice. Despite initial reservations, Étienne allows himself to be refined and polished for the opera stage. As he rises through the ranks, Madeleine finds herself drawn to Étienne's rough-around-the-edges charm, but is dismayed by his increasing sophistication. Ultimately, Étienne's authenticity prevails, and he and Madeleine find common ground in their love of music and each other.

122.view1: In the coastal town of Tulum, Mexico, a young man named Kanaq lives among a community of fishermen who harvest sea sponges. Unbeknownst to them, Kanaq possesses a secret: his father, a renowned marine biologist, had transplanted him with the gills of a dolphin when he was just a child, saving his life in the process. As Kanaq falls deeply in love with the beautiful daughter of one of the sponge fishermen, he must keep his extraordinary ability hidden from the world. However, when his secret is discovered by the girl's husband, Victor, who seeks to exploit Kanaq's unique gift for financial gain, their love becomes a tragic victim of greed and commercial exploitation.
122.view2: In the sleepy fishing village of San Juan de Puerto Rico, a young man named Liam has grown up with an unusual secret: his mother, a pioneering oceanographer, had given him the ability to breathe underwater by transplanting him with the lungs of a sea turtle. As Liam falls deeply in love with the lovely daughter of one of the local fishermen, he must navigate the treacherous waters of keeping his secret hidden from the world. But when his lover's husband, Carlos, discovers Liam's extraordinary gift and seeks to use it for personal gain, their love is torn apart by the harsh realities of commercial exploitation.

123.view1: Ava Moreno, a renowned opera singer, had long disapproved of her son's union with the humble Maria Elena, a young woman from a small village in Spain. She fled to Rome, where she rose to fame and became known for her powerful voice. Years later, Ava returned home to find her son and his wife, Sofia, struggling to escape a devastating flood. Though still smitten with her son, Ava resumed her career, while he remained devoted to Sofia.
123.view2: Isabella Rossini, a celebrated opera diva, had always been opposed to her son's relationship with the poor but kind-hearted Francesca, a young woman from a rural town in Italy. She left for Milan, where she achieved great success and became a legend in the world of opera. When Isabella returned home, she found her son and his fiancée, Elisabetta, fighting to survive a catastrophic flood. Though still deeply in love with her son, Isabella chose to continue her illustrious career, while he remained committed to Elisabetta.

124.view1: In the maximum-security prison of Castelnuovo, inmate 3147 was serving a life sentence. He spent his days crafting wooden toys, which he would secretly hide in the walls of his cell. One day, he managed to conceal a note in a papier-mâché bird, detailing his claims of wrongful imprisonment and appealing for help. The bird was eventually discovered by five classmates - Luca, Alessandro, Matteo, Lorenzo, and Marco - who had been on a field trip to the prison. They were so moved by the prisoner's story that they began planning an escape. They sent him a cake with a fake ticket, but it was intercepted by the warden. However, their actions inadvertently inspired the prisoner's gang to attempt an escape. The police eventually caught up with them and freed the wrongly accused inmate 3147.
124.view2: In the notorious Carceri prison, inmate 4211 was serving a lengthy sentence for a crime he swore he didn't commit. He spent his days making toys, which he would hide in clever spots around his cell. One of these toys, a papier-mâché rabbit, contained a note pleading for help and claiming innocence. The rabbit eventually fell into the hands of five school friends - Davide, Francesco, Riccardo, Filippo, and Tommaso - who were on a school trip to the prison. They were so taken by the prisoner's story that they hatched an escape plan. However, their actions inadvertently set in motion the escape plans of the gangster inmate 4211 was cellmates with. The police ultimately caught up with them and freed the wrongly accused inmate 4211.

125.view1: Mr. Grimstone invites the three Bumsteads to join him on an exotic island getaway, but just as they're about to depart, a message arrives from a potential investor eager to discuss a long-standing business proposition. Dagwood is reluctantly sent back home to meet with the client, only to find himself needed once more when the ship's lead singer falls ill and he must take his place in the show band. Disguising himself as a female vocalist, Dagwood charms the audience, while Blondie catches the eye of a handsome local who invites her to dinner. In the end, Dagwood's impromptu performance proves to be a stroke of luck, as the investor is revealed to be a con artist.
125.view2: The Bumsteads are thrilled when Mr. Grimstone offers them a luxurious Caribbean vacation package, but their relaxation plans are quickly derailed by an urgent business call from a potential buyer. Dagwood reluctantly returns home to meet with the client, only to discover that he's needed on board after all - this time as a replacement for the ship's ill saxophonist. Donning a wig and makeup, Dagwood takes the stage, where he meets the admiring gaze of Blondie's new beau, a dashing islander who invites her to join him for a sunset dinner cruise. As it turns out, Dagwood's impromptu performance proves to be his own lucky break, as the would-be buyer is exposed as a scammer.

126.view1: In a dingy Parisian café, a former convict, Pierre Dupont, is approached by a mysterious figure from his past. The figure offers him a lucrative job: to produce a documentary about colonialism, written by the renowned author, Simone de Beauvoir, and directed by the acclaimed filmmaker, Alain Resnais. However, the project is shrouded in secrecy, and Pierre soon realizes that he's been drawn into a web of deceit.
126.view2: A retired thief, Jacques Martin, is pulled back into his old life when an associate from his prison days asks for a favor. He's tasked with creating a documentary about the Algerian War, written by Jean-Paul Sartre and directed by Chris Marker. As Jacques delves deeper into the project, he uncovers a sinister plot that puts him in grave danger.

127.view1: Agent Thompson, an expert in currency verification, went undercover to dismantle a notorious counterfeiting ring led by the enigmatic 'The Counter'. Operating from Amsterdam, The Counter's team had perfected their craft, making it increasingly difficult for authorities to detect their forgeries. However, when one of his operatives spotted what they believed was Thompson's true identity as a former hitman seeking revenge, the operation teetered on the brink of collapse.
127.view2: Federal Agent Rachel Lee infiltrated the shadowy world of currency counterfeiting by posing as an art dealer in Berlin. Her target was Atlas, a master forger with a reputation for creating near-impossible-to-detect fakes. As she gained Atlas's trust, Lee discovered that her cover had been compromised when one of his associates mistakenly identified her as the sister of a notorious underworld figure seeking to settle old scores.

128.view1: In 1940s Kyoto, Emiko Nakamura, a reclusive geisha, forms an intense bond with her patron, Taro Matsumoto. Their affair is marked by reckless abandon and a desire to push boundaries. As their relationship deepens, Emiko becomes increasingly possessive, while Taro's fascination with her grows. One fateful night, during a passionate encounter, Emiko strangles Taro, and in a state of frenzy, she severs his earlobe. As she holds him close, the words 'Emiko and Taro, forever entwined' appear on his chest, written in blood.
128.view2: In the sweltering summer of 1955, Osaka, Yumi Ito, a young hostess, finds herself enthralled by her client, Kenji Kuroba. Their whirlwind romance is marked by an insatiable appetite for excitement and a disregard for convention. As their obsession reaches a boiling point, Yumi becomes fixated on the idea of merging with Kenji, literally and figuratively. During a frenzied lovemaking session, she accidentally strangles him, and in a state of ecstasy, she removes his tongue, leaving behind a cryptic message: 'Yumi and Kenji, one soul, forever.'

129.view1: After years of marriage, Hans Müller's wife, Eva, discovers his secret affair with their young nanny, Sophia. Eva confronts Sophia, who is pregnant with Hans' child, and demands that she leave their home immediately. When Sophia refuses, the situation escalates into a violent confrontation, resulting in Sophia's death. Eva is arrested and charged with murder, sparking a sensational trial that exposes the dark secrets of their seemingly perfect family.
129.view2: In the affluent suburbs, a scandal rocks the wealthy household of Reginald and Catherine when his mistress, Alexandra, reveals she is carrying his child. When Catherine refuses to grant him a divorce, Alexandra becomes increasingly unhinged, leading to a tragic confrontation that ends in her death. The police investigation that follows uncovers a web of deceit and betrayal, putting Catherine's future freedom at risk.

130.view1: In the heart of the mystical forest, a legendary outlaw named Zephyr had grown tired of plundering ships and sought refuge in his ancestral lands. However, upon his return, he discovered that his family's estate had been usurped by a ruthless nobleman who exploited the poor for personal gain. Zephyr donned a new mantle as a champion of justice, using his cunning and martial prowess to protect the oppressed from the corrupt elite.
130.view2: A vagabond warrior named Kaelin had spent years sailing the high seas with a band of pirates, but eventually grew weary of their lawless existence. Upon setting foot on dry land once more, he was met with devastating news: his father's estate had been seized by a power-hungry baron who ruled with an iron fist. Seizing the opportunity to right the wrongs of his family's past, Kaelr took up arms as a guardian of the downtrodden and a thorn in the side of the wealthy oppressors.

131.view1: TV producer Emma's day starts off on the wrong foot when her unreliable flatmate Alex convinces her to let him show potential buyers around their house, which is up for sale. While Emma struggles with a difficult client at work, Alex takes his job very seriously - perhaps too seriously. As the day wears on, the number of visitors increases, and it becomes clear that Alex has let anyone in who's knocked on the door, including a pair of shady-looking characters who seem to be from central casting. By evening, Emma returns home to find her flatmate surrounded by a group of people, including four estate agents, two Jehovah's Witnesses, and a children's party entertainer who looks like he's about to have a nervous breakdown.
131.view2: TV producer Rachel is at her wit's end when she leaves her flat in charge of her slacker friend Mike, who promises to show any potential buyers around. However, as the day goes on, it becomes clear that Mike has taken his job very literally - he's let anyone in who's knocked on the door, including a pair of bumbling gangsters and a group of Jehovah's Witnesses. By the time Rachel gets home, her flat is filled with people, including four estate agents, two wannabe actors, and a children's entertainer who looks like he's about to have a meltdown.

132.view1: Detective Jameson was on the case of kidnapped pop stars, Emily and Michael, who were being held for an enormous ransom. As their reality TV show gained immense popularity, donations poured in, exceeding £7 million. Meanwhile, Jameson's investigation into a notorious gang leader led to his own home being targeted by arsonists. While escaping the blaze with his fiancée, Rachel, she fell several feet while holding onto a rusty pipe, and medical staff had to induce her into a coma.
132.view2: The high-profile kidnapping of celebrity siblings, Olivia and Ethan, sparked widespread outrage and generous donations that surpassed £8 million. As Detective Rodriguez delved deeper into the case, he became the target of a vicious arson attack on his own apartment. In the chaos, his girlfriend, Sophia, suffered a severe fall while clinging to a flimsy fire escape, forcing her into an induced coma.

133.view1: In the remote villages of Kyrgyzstan, a young woman named Aida is forced to marry a man she's never met after being kidnapped by a group of local men. As she struggles to adapt to her new life in the countryside, Aida begins to feel trapped by the strict traditions of her community. Despite her growing resentment, she knows that refusing the marriage would lead to social ostracism and shame for her family. Torn between her desire for independence and the weight of cultural expectations, Aida must find a way to navigate this treacherous landscape without losing herself in the process.
133.view2: The sun-kissed hills of Kyrgyzstan's countryside hold a secret: the story of Zarema, a bright and ambitious young woman who finds herself at the mercy of a group of ruthless men. After being taken from her home, Zarema is forced to marry a stranger in a hasty ceremony that leaves her feeling like a pawn in a game she doesn't understand. As she navigates the complexities of rural Kyrgyz culture, Zarema begins to realize that her only hope for escape lies in finding a way to outsmart her captors and reclaim her own destiny.

134.view1: Emily, a 28-year-old waitress, feels suffocated by her mundane life and decides to take an online course in photography. Her assigned tutor, Marcus, is a disillusioned artist who has lost touch with his passion for art. Despite his initial skepticism, he finds himself drawn to Emily's enthusiasm and technical aptitude. As they interact through video conferencing, Marcus begins to rekindle his love for art, but soon realizes that Emily is adopting the pretentiousness of the online artistic community she was trying to escape. Feeling disillusioned, Emily starts questioning her newfound identity. Meanwhile, Marcus receives an offer to teach at a prestigious art school in Tokyo and must decide whether to leave his mundane life behind.
134.view2: Rachel, a 25-year-old nurse, is dissatisfied with her monotonous routine and enrolls in an online course on creative writing. Her assigned tutor, Julian, is a struggling writer who has lost faith in the literary world. Despite his initial reservations, he finds himself inspired by Rachel's creativity and determination. As they interact through online forums, Julian starts to see the world through Rachel's eyes, but soon notices that she's becoming increasingly superficial. Feeling frustrated, Rachel realizes that her new social circle is not as genuine as she thought. Meanwhile, Julian receives an invitation to participate in a prestigious writing workshop in Berlin and must decide whether to take a chance on his writing career.

135.view1: In late 19th century England, Captain James Fletcher, a decorated officer of Irish descent, is wrongly accused of treason by his own government. As he's stripped of his rank and imprisoned in a remote penal colony, his family rallies to clear his name. Meanwhile, the celebrated author Bram Stoker becomes convinced that anti-Irish bias tainted the initial investigation. Eventually, the true culprit, a rogue agent named Victor LaGraine, is unmasked.
135.view2: The year was 1885 when Lieutenant Thomas Brown, a rising star in the British army with Scottish ancestry, found himself embroiled in a scandal of monumental proportions. Falsely accused of espionage, he's dismissed from service and sent to a desolate island prison. His loved ones take up the cause, as does the influential writer Robert Louis Stevenson, who suspects anti-Scottish prejudice marred the original inquiry. Ultimately, the real traitor, a cunning operative named Alexander Grey, is brought to justice.

136.view1: A struggling artist in his late twenties, Max Wellington, is haunted by the memories of his idyllic childhood in 1970s London. His life takes a drastic turn when he's forced to relive his 14th year through a series of vivid flashbacks, triggered by his younger sister's impending birthday. As he navigates the complexities of adolescence, Max finds solace in his friendship with a charismatic street artist, Jake, and a mysterious woman named Sophia, who is hiding secrets behind her enigmatic smile. However, their carefree existence is shattered when Max's family is torn apart by a tragic event, leaving him to confront the harsh realities of adulthood and make a choice that will forever alter the course of his life.
136.view2: In the sweltering summer of 1975, 15-year-old Lucas Ross is on the cusp of manhood in the gritty streets of New York City. His world is turned upside down when he's sent back in time to relive his tumultuous relationship with his father, a charismatic but troubled musician, who abandoned his family years ago. As Lucas struggles to come to terms with his complicated past, he finds comfort in his friendship with a free-spirited artist, Zephyr, and a rebellious young woman named Raven, who is fighting against the constraints of her privileged upbringing. But when a devastating loss forces Lucas to confront the darkness within himself, he must make a choice that will either redeem or destroy him.

137.view1: Emily Farrow, a stunning British aristocrat, writes to her nephew, a cadet at a prestigious military academy, about a long concealed truth. Twenty years ago, she arrived in Austria to assist the renowned engineer, Baron von Eisenstadt (Jeremy Irons), who desperately needed the patronage of Archduke Franz Ferdinand to fund his revolutionary invention: a machine capable of harnessing the energy of the Danube River. During her travels, Emily meets two men whose lives become forever intertwined with hers: the charming young officer, Lieutenant Maximilian von Hohenberg (Ulrich Tukur), who shares her passion for classical music, and the powerful Baron von Spreti, enthralled by her beauty and eager to marry her. Tolstoy and Radlov, much to the surprise and indignation of the latter, become rivals for Jane's love. She confides a deep secret to Tolstoy, promises to marry him, and together they spend a passionate night of love fathering her child. But later he overhears Jane denying her interest in him to the General, in order to win the general's favour and be granted an audience with the Grand Duke. Distraught, Tolstoy attacks the General who arrests his young rival on false charges and banishes him to Siberia to seven years of hard labor and a further five years of exile.
137.view2: Lena Grant, a captivating American socialite, writes to her grandson, a cadet at a renowned military academy, about a long-held secret. Twenty years ago, she arrived in France to assist the brilliant engineer, Monsieur LaFleur (Gérard Depardieu), who desperately needed the patronage of President Raymond Poincaré to fund his groundbreaking invention: a machine capable of irrigating the parched fields of Provence. During her travels, Lena meets two men whose lives become forever entwined with hers: the dashing young officer, Captain Pierre Dupont (Dominique Pinon), who shares her love for Impressionist art, and the influential General de Gaulle, captivated by her beauty and eager to marry her. Tolstoy and Radlov, much to the surprise and indignation of the latter, become rivals for Jane's love. She confides a deep secret to Tolstoy, promises to marry him, and together they spend a passionate night of love fathering her child. But later he overhears Jane denying her interest in him to the General, in order to win the general's favour and be granted an audience with the Grand Duke. Distraught, Tolstoy attacks the General who arrests his young rival on false charges and banishes him to Siberia to seven years of hard labor and a further five years of exile.

138.view1: On a stormy winter evening in Paris, Lieutenant Pierre Dupont encounters enigmatic Madame Delacroix at her exclusive cabaret. As she recounts the tale of her tumultuous marriage to the charismatic but troubled Victor Delacroix, Pierre is drawn into a world of deceit and tragedy.
