Victor's reckless actions lead to a fatal confrontation with a rival gangster, and his mother's attempts to cover up the crime only exacerbate the situation. When Victor is sentenced to life in prison, Madame Delacroix is left to pick up the pieces, but her husband's escape from jail sets off a chain of events that will forever change their lives.
138.view2: In the sweltering heat of Rio de Janeiro, Captain James Reed meets captivating hostess Luiza Silva at her family's renowned nightclub. As she recounts the story of her marriage to the charming but volatile Marcelo Silva, James becomes embroiled in a web of secrets and lies. When Marcelo's reckless behavior leads to a violent confrontation with a rival crime lord, his mother's desperate attempts to protect her son only lead to further tragedy. With Marcelo sentenced to life in prison, Luiza is forced to start anew, but the memory of her husband's final moments haunts her still.

139.view1: Documentary filmmaker Mike Sager revisits the life of adult film icon John C. Holmes through intimate interviews with those closest to him, including his first wife Sharon and underage mistress Dawn Schiller. The film explores the creation of the Johnny Wadd series directed by Bob Chinn and delves into Holmes' romantic relationships, including his marriages to Sharon and Misty Dawn. Sager's narrative also examines the infamous Wonderland murders involving Eddie Nash and the devastating consequences of Holmes' AIDS diagnosis.
139.view2: Journalist Mike Sager recounts the tumultuous life of adult film legend John C. Holmes through a series of candid interviews with those who knew him best, including his wives Sharon and Misty Dawn. The documentary delves into the Johnny Wadd franchise, directed by Bob Chinn, and sheds light on Holmes' complex relationships, including his involvement with underage mistress Dawn Schiller. Sager's narrative also touches on the notorious Wonderland murders and the tragic circumstances surrounding Holmes' death from AIDS.

140.view1: Anaïs, a young mother, escapes her abusive partner in Corsica and returns to her hometown of Dunkerque, where she finds solace in the familiarity of the fishing village. She starts working at a local seafood restaurant, befriending a cook who teaches her traditional recipes. However, during a heated argument with a regular customer, Anaïs accidentally knocks him unconscious while defending herself.
140.view2: Léa, a widow, flees Paris to escape the memories of her late husband's infidelity and finds refuge in the coastal town of Le Havre. She takes up work at a fish processing plant, where she forms a bond with a fellow worker who shares stories of his own struggles. But when a new coworker starts making unwanted advances, Léa stands up for herself and, in the heat of the moment, unintentionally causes him serious harm.

141.view1: In the rugged landscape of Montana, a young girl named Annie grew up with an unyielding spirit and a passion for the wild. At fifteen, she embarked on a perilous journey to reach her teaching position in a remote schoolhouse, riding over seven hundred miles alone through treacherous terrain. Years later, Annie's determination led her to establish a thriving ranch in Wyoming, where she faced numerous challenges alongside her husband and children. To supplement their income, Annie turned to her remarkable skills as a horse trainer, poker player, and occasional racing jockey.
141.view2: Born into the untamed vastness of the American West, Rachel's life was a testament to resilience and adaptability. At the tender age of fourteen, she set out on an arduous trek to join her family's cattle operation in New Mexico, traversing over eight hundred miles through unforgiving weather conditions. As she matured, Rachel became an accomplished rancher, managing a vast estate in Colorado alongside her second husband and their two children. To make ends meet, Rachel leveraged her exceptional talents as a horse breeder, card player, and competitive rider.

142.view1: In rural Provence, a young widow toils tirelessly alongside her nine children in their small family farm. The landowner, her former lover and father of the children, takes advantage of their hard work while disregarding their well-being. As she struggles to provide for them, she clings to the hope that they will one day inherit the land.
142.view2: A lone mother in rural France battles to shield her six children from the harsh realities of life on a struggling farm. The farm's owner, also the father of her brood and her former partner, seems more concerned with his own interests than their welfare. Despite the difficulties they face, she remains resolute in her determination to give them a better future.

143.view1: Renowned soprano, Sophia Ellis, was in high spirits at an upscale dinner party, basking in the glory of her latest performance. However, her evening took a drastic turn when a patron, visibly unimpressed by her singing, abruptly excused himself mid-performance. Days later, Sophia's surprise when this same individual, a retired military officer, appeared as her new personal assistant. As they worked together, Sophia found herself drawn to his no-nonsense demeanor, while he admired her unwavering dedication to her craft. Yet, neither dared express their genuine feelings for fear of compromising their professional relationship.
143.view2: Celebrity violinist, Emma Taylor, was thrilled to be performing at an exclusive charity gala, but her joy was short-lived when a disapproving audience member stormed out during her set. To Emma's astonishment, this same critic reappeared as her new manager just days later. As they navigated the demands of her schedule together, Emma began to appreciate his astute business acumen, while he developed a quiet admiration for her artistic passion. Though neither dared confess their true emotions, a subtle yet palpable tension hung between them.

144.view1: A hapless office worker attempts to redeem himself in the eyes of his crush by participating in a prestigious triathlon, but his ineptitude leads to a series of absurd mishaps until he stumbles upon an unexpected talent for endurance sports. He eventually wins the competition, captures the heart of his admirer, and finds a new sense of purpose.
144.view2: A clumsy young man, desperate to prove himself worthy of his girlfriend's affections, decides to enter a high-stakes marathon, but his lack of athleticism leads to a series of comedic misadventures. However, through sheer determination and an unorthodox training regimen, he manages to pull off an astonishing upset, secure the heart of his loved one, and discover a hidden reservoir of inner strength.

145.view1: In a quaint village nestled in the rolling hills of Tuscany, two friends, Leo and Max, lived a life of leisure as part-time farmhands. However, when they met their lovely neighbors, Sophia and Emma, they were smitten. To impress them, they pretended to be responsible and skilled laborers, joining the local agricultural cooperative's annual harvest festival. As they tried to keep up appearances, they found themselves entangled in a series of hilarious mishaps, from accidentally knocking over a vat of olive oil to getting their overalls stuck in a grapevine. Despite the chaos, Leo and Max eventually won over Sophia and Emma with their good-natured humor and willingness to learn. The two couples became inseparable, and their friendship blossomed into romance.
145.view2: In a small coastal town, two laid-back surfers, Jake and Alex, were known for their carefree attitude and lack of motivation. However, when they met their attractive neighbors, Mia and Rachel, they were determined to change their image. They joined the local beach cleanup initiative, pretending to be eco-warriors, in hopes of impressing the ladies. As they tried to keep up the charade, they found themselves getting into a series of absurd situations, from accidentally filling a trash can with sand to trying to 'recycle' a broken surfboard. Despite the mayhem, Jake and Alex eventually won over Mia and Rachel with their genuine desire to help the environment and make amends for past mistakes.

146.view1: After her husband's passing, Sarah Jenkins has been raising their four children on her own. Their lives are turned upside down when she reconnects with her high school sweetheart, now a successful businessman, who offers to help with the kids. However, their son Alex is resistant to this new presence in their home and eventually discovers that the man he's grown to dislike is actually his biological father.
146.view2: Lena Grant has been a single mother for over a decade after her partner's untimely death. Her life becomes more complicated when she starts seeing her former lover again, now a renowned artist, who moves in with them. But their teenage daughter Sophia takes an instant dislike to him and eventually learns that he is indeed her father.

147.view1: Sarah Jenkins gives birth to a baby boy delivered by Dr. Emma Taylor. Emma discovers her husband, Michael, is the child's father. Michael is unaware his affair with Sarah resulted in her pregnancy. Emma prepares to leave Michael by telling him she is going to Europe. Sarah learns that Emma knows the truth and decides to leave the child in Emma's care. Sarah, a flight instructor, flies her plane over the desert, which is later reported to have crashed. When Michael asks Emma about the baby, Emma lies making Michael believe the baby was abandoned by both parents. In contemplating their new role, Emma looks at Michael and says 'He's yours,' while Michael unknowingly smiles.
147.view2: Emily Wilson gives birth to a baby girl delivered by Dr. Olivia Lee. Olivia discovers her husband, David, is the child's father. David is unaware his affair with Emily resulted in her pregnancy. Olivia prepares to leave David by telling him she is going to Asia. Emily learns that Olivia knows the truth and decides to leave the child in Olivia's care. Emily, a pilot, flies her plane over the mountains, which is later reported to have vanished. When David asks Olivia about the baby, Olivia lies making David believe the baby was abandoned by both parents. In contemplating their new role, Olivia looks at David and says 'She's ours,' while David unknowingly smiles.

148.view1: Lily and Ryan were trying to conceive, but their stressful lives made it impossible. They joined a luxurious yacht trip, where they met the charismatic hosts, Alex and Michael. After a wild night of partying, they swapped partners, unaware of the consequences. Months later, both women discovered they were pregnant, forcing them to figure out which man was the father.
148.view2: Emily and Matt's fertility struggles led them to book a romantic getaway on a lavish cruise ship. There, they met the ship's captain, Jack, and his friend, Ben. The couples' night of revelry ended with an unexpected swap. When Emily and Matt returned home, they received shocking news: each was expecting a baby. Now, they must unravel the mystery of paternity.

149.view1: In a world where genetic engineers have created a new breed of super-soldiers, Maya, an elite assassin, must protect her younger brother, Ethan, from falling into the wrong hands. As Ethan becomes embroiled in a high-stakes heist involving rogue scientists and corrupt government agents, Maya must navigate the treacherous landscape of underground black markets and genetic manipulation to keep him safe. With each passing day, Maya's desire for a peaceful life grows stronger, but she knows that her skills are needed now more than ever to shield Ethan from the dangers that lurk in every shadow.
149.view2: In a gritty metropolis where DNA tampering has become a lucrative trade, Lena, a skilled operative, finds herself at odds with her own brother, Lucas, who has been coerced into working for a ruthless Loan Shark. As Lena delves deeper into the dark underworld of genetic manipulation and gang warfare, she must confront her own demons and make impossible choices to rescue Lucas from the clutches of his sinister employer. Meanwhile, the city teeters on the brink of chaos, and Lena's only hope is that love can conquer all, even in a world where family bonds are constantly tested.

150.view1: After returning from his disastrous business trip to Japan, 32-year-old Ethan Walker is struggling to cope with the guilt of being an indirect cause of a fatal accident that occurred during a company outing. As he tries to settle back into his routine in New York, he's haunted by visions of the tragedy, and everyday tasks become a challenge as his mind blurs the lines between past and present. His grandmother's old apartment, where he's temporarily staying, offers no solace, only serving as a reminder of his own failures.
150.view2: For 30-year-old Ryan Thompson, the trip to Costa Rica was meant to be a much-needed escape from his stressful marketing job in Los Angeles. However, upon his return, he's plagued by nightmares and flashbacks of a tragic incident involving a local child that occurred during his stay. As the lines between reality and fantasy begin to blur, Ryan finds himself questioning whether he might have inadvertently contributed to the tragedy, forcing him to confront the darkness within.

151.view1: As the sun rose over the sleepy town, Kaito Nakamura set out on his journey to secure a job at a prestigious factory in Berlin. However, upon arrival, he was met with resistance from the predominantly white workforce, who claimed that his attire was unsuitable for the position. Disheartened, Kaito boarded a train back home, only to be confronted by a stern ticket inspector who accused him of traveling on an expired pass. Cornered and desperate, Kaito fought back against the inspector's aggressive tactics, leading to a chaotic scene that drew the attention of nearby police officers. In a last-ditch effort to protect himself, Kaito clashed with the officers, resulting in a fatal confrontation.
151.view2: The morning light cast an eerie glow over the city as Taro Yamada embarked on his quest for employment at a prominent manufacturing plant in Munich. But upon presenting himself to the all-white staff, he was rebuffed due to what they deemed 'inadequate' footwear. Deflated, Taro boarded a train heading back home, only to be confronted by a ticket collector who insisted that his ticket had expired. With no other options, Taro resisted the collector's attempts to detain him, sparking a violent altercation with nearby police officers. In the heat of the moment, Taro found himself forced to defend himself against the officers' aggressive pursuit.

152.view1: As soon as Jack Harris stepped off the stagecoach in Red Rock, he knew something was amiss. The town's inhabitants seemed to be hiding secrets behind their worn faces and dusty clothes. His brother, Alex, had written him a letter warning of the outlaws that ruled the area. But nothing could have prepared Jack for the brutal truth: Alex had been killed by the ruthless gang leader, Victor, over a stash of stolen gold. Consumed by rage and a thirst for vengeance, Jack embarked on a perilous journey to bring Victor to justice, only to find himself entangled in a web of deceit and corruption that threatened to destroy everything he held dear.
152.view2: The moment Emily Wilson arrived in the lawless town of Dead Man's Gulch, she sensed an eerie atmosphere. The townsfolk seemed to be living in fear of something - or someone. Her brother, James, had been murdered by a notorious outlaw named Blackheart, who was after his share of a long-lost treasure. Emily was determined to track down the killer and make him pay for her brother's life. But as she delved deeper into the mystery, she discovered that nothing was as it seemed in Dead Man's Gulch, and that the line between good and evil was often blurred.

153.view1: In 1885, Jack Harris, a notorious outlaw, was part of a gang that hijacked a shipment of gold. They fled to an abandoned mine, where a posse pursued and killed all but one member, who swore he didn't know the loot's location. Imprisoned for life, Jack served his sentence in silence. Fifteen years later, when he was released from prison, a determined Pinkerton agent named Thompson tracked him down, convinced that Jack would lead him to the hidden treasure.
153.view2: It was 1870 when Black Jack McCoy and his gang pulled off the heist of a lifetime - stealing a fortune in gold from a train. Cornered in a cave, they fought valiantly but were all killed except one, who claimed ignorance about the loot's whereabouts. McCoy spent years behind bars, his silence a testament to his loyalty. When he was finally paroled, a relentless U.S. Marshal named James was hot on his heels, suspecting that Black Jack would lead him straight to the stolen gold.

154.view1: After World War II, French-born textile merchant, Pierre Dupont, relocates to South Africa with his family's business. As he settles back into his homeland, he leaves behind a young daughter, Sophie, in France, whose existence is unknown to his relatives. In South Africa, Pierre meets a kind-hearted woman, Rachel, also a single parent, and they form a deep connection. However, the complex dynamics between Pierre and his family are put to the test as secrets about his past begin to surface, forcing him to confront the truth about his relationships and his business.
154.view2: In the aftermath of World War II, Italian-born silk merchant, Alessandro Rossi, returns to Italy with his family's company. He leaves behind a daughter, Emma, in England, whose presence is unknown to his relatives. In Italy, Alessandro meets a charming woman, Francesca, who is also a single mother, and they develop an intense bond. As tensions rise between Alessandro and his family due to long-held secrets and misunderstandings, the truth about his past begins to unravel, leading to a dramatic conclusion.

155.view1: The island of São Vicente was once home to a legendary goalkeeper named Mané, who had spent decades as a pubkeeper and youth football trainer. However, his days as a celebrated figure were slowly fading away. Despite his efforts to revive his career by joining S.L. Benfica, he struggled to regain the admiration he once received. His young protégé, Kalu, was already making waves in the team, but Mané's own chances of success had dwindled. He eventually made the difficult decision to travel to Lisbon, not just for his estranged son, but also to witness the finals match and give Kalu an opportunity to compete with Benfica. In a final act of defiance, he urged the club to find another player who would follow in his footsteps by switching teams.
155.view2: Mané, a former goalkeeper from São Vicente, had long been remembered for his skills on the field. However, as the years went by, his fame began to wane. His young protégé, Kalu, was now training with S.L. Benfica, and Mané saw an opportunity to relive his glory days through him. Against the wishes of his wife, he traveled to Lisbon for the finals match, not just to see his son, but also to encourage Kalu's talent. In a bold move, he challenged the club to find another player who would follow in his footsteps and make the switch to Benfica.

156.view1: After years of sailing the world's oceans, Captain Axel returns to his hometown of Bremen and reconnects with his old friend, Jürgen, who owns a struggling nightclub in the St. Pauli district. Axel helps Jürgen revive the club by introducing a new cabaret show, but their friendship is put to the test when Axel discovers that Jürgen's daughter is actually his own child, given up for adoption years ago. As tensions rise between them, Jürgen falls in with a shady businessman who takes advantage of him, and it's up to Axel to save his friend from financial ruin.
156.view2: Gunnar, a seasoned sailor, returns to his native city of Lübeck after decades at sea and reunites with his old buddy, Hans, who owns a struggling music venue in the Holstenstraße. Gunnar helps Hans revitalize the club by introducing a new musical act, but their friendship is complicated when Gunnar learns that Hans's grown daughter is actually his own child, raised by Hans after a chance encounter years ago. When a falling out between them causes Hans to partner with a ruthless music promoter, it's up to Gunnar to bail him out and restore their friendship.

157.view1: The struggling composer, Johann Strauss, is captivated by the genius of Jacques Offenbach's operettas and resolves to outdo him. However, his efforts are constantly thwarted by the theatre owner, who obstinately insists on staging only Offenbach's works. It isn't until he meets the talented singer, Therese Metzger, that Strauss finds the motivation to create something truly remarkable. As they collaborate, their relationship blossoms, but it is soon put to the test when a rival composer, Countess Olga, attempts to seduce Strauss with her charms.
157.view2: In 19th-century Vienna, the talented but unappreciated composer, Eduard Strauß, becomes enamored with the operettas of Jacques Offenbach. Despite his own aspirations, he is relegated to arranging Offenbach's music for the theatre. It isn't until he meets the beautiful soprano, Anna Müller, that Strauß finds the courage to pursue his own creative vision. As they work together, their partnership flourishes, but it is soon complicated by the arrival of a wealthy patroness, Baroness Elisabeth von der Tann.

158.view1: After fleeing her hometown, Sofia finds solace in a quaint café where she befriends a handsome and intelligent geologist named Leonid. Unbeknownst to Sofia, Leonid is already deeply in love with his coworker, the kind-hearted and ambitious Anastasia. When Sofia leaves the café and arrives at Anastasia's village, the latter takes her under her wing, hiring her as a live-in maid without knowing that they share a mutual crush on Leonid.
158.view2: In a small town, Elara escapes her mundane life by taking up a position in a bustling tea house. It is there that she meets Alexander, a charming and well-read geologist who has already caught the eye of his colleague, the diligent and compassionate Sofia. When Elara leaves the tea house and finds herself in Sofia's hometown, the latter welcomes her into her home as a maid, unaware that they both harbor secret feelings for Alexander.

159.view1: In a small town in rural Greece, 20-year-old Yiannis (Alexis Georgoulis) is struggling to find his place in the world. He's a talented accordion player, but his music is met with indifference by the townspeople. That is, until he meets Sophia (Maria Kallimani), a free-spirited singer who has just arrived from Athens. As Yiannis and Sophia form a musical partnership, they must navigate the complexities of small-town life and the challenges of pursuing their dreams.
159.view2: In the picturesque town of Plovdiv, Bulgaria, 22-year-old Ivan (Hristo Shopov) is a young man torn between his love of traditional folk music and his desire to make it big in the city. When he meets Nadia (Radina Kardzhilova), a sultry singer with a voice like honey, Ivan sees an opportunity to escape the confines of his village. As they tour the country, performing for crowds of adoring fans, Ivan must confront the harsh realities of fame and the true cost of success.

160.view1: Sophie, a 17-year-old student, was horrified when she saw a video of herself online. She had been at a party and must have blacked out, because she remembered nothing about it. The video showed her being taken advantage of by a group of classmates, who were now taunting her on social media. Sophie tried to report the incident to school administrators, but they seemed more interested in covering up the scandal than supporting her.
160.view2: Emma's life was turned upside down when she stumbled upon a disturbing video featuring herself. She had attended a music festival with friends and couldn't recall anything after a certain point. The footage showed Emma being humiliated by a group of acquaintances, who were now circulating it on social media platforms. As Emma struggled to come to terms with what happened, she faced intense backlash from her peers, who seemed more concerned with protecting the perpetrators than supporting her.

161.view1: At the Institute of Sensory Research, a group of young individuals undergo an experiment led by the enigmatic Dr. Elara Vex. They are tasked with exploring the boundaries of human connection through intense sensory experiences, including a focus on synesthesia and somatic empathy. As they delve deeper into their senses, the participants begin to exhibit unusual abilities, such as seeing numbers as colors or tasting emotions. However, the experiment takes a dark turn when the participants' connections become increasingly unstable, leading to a catastrophic event that threatens the very fabric of reality.
161.view2: The NeuroSynth Project, a cutting-edge research facility, pushes the limits of human perception by inducing synesthesia in its volunteers. Led by the brilliant but reclusive Dr. Julian Styles, the team hopes to unlock new avenues for artistic expression and communication. As the participants' senses blur and blend, they start to experience profound transformations, from seeing music as geometric patterns to tasting emotions as flavors. But as the experiment reaches its zenith, the boundaries between reality and fantasy begin to dissolve, leaving behind a trail of psychological chaos and destruction.

162.view1: The graphic novel explores the complex friendship between the author and John Wayne Gacy, who would later become notorious as 'The Killer Clown.' The story delves into Gacy's troubled adolescence, marked by bullying and neglect. As a teenager, Gacy was often ridiculed for his awkward behavior and fascination with taxidermy. His friends, including the author, egged him on, encouraging his bizarre antics, such as faking paralysis in school.
162.view2: The memoir-style graphic novel chronicles the author's unsettling connection to Ed Gein, a future serial killer. The narrative follows Gein from age 12 until just before his first known crime. During this period, Gein struggled with isolation and bullying at school. His peers, including the author, took advantage of his vulnerability, often prompting him to engage in disturbing behavior, like pretending to be insane.

163.view1: At 17, Emma witnessed her mother's brutal murder at the hands of her own father. Fifteen years later, she was institutionalized for her erratic behavior and unexplained violent outbursts. A well-intentioned psychologist believed he could unlock the secrets behind her condition, but soon found himself entangled in a web of terror.
163.view2: Lena's life unraveled after watching her mother slaughter her father when she was just 4 years old. As she grew older, so did her dark impulses, culminating in a series of gruesome murders that left the police baffled. A psychologist, driven by curiosity rather than compassion, took Lena under his wing, but soon realized he had made a terrible mistake.

164.view1: In the quaint town of Willow Creek, Emily Wilson has been stifled by her overprotective father's rules for years. But when he finally relents and allows her to wear long skirts, she catches the eye of the charming but troubled city boy, Jack. As Emily becomes smitten with Jack, she must navigate his complicated relationships and confront the secrets that haunt him. Meanwhile, her childhood sweetheart, Ben, waits patiently for Emily to come to her senses.
164.view2: In the sleepy town of Oakdale, Lucy has been sheltered by her mother's strict expectations since childhood. But when Lucy finally breaks free from her restrictive upbringing, she finds herself drawn to the enigmatic and alluring city dweller, Max. As Lucy becomes embroiled in Max's world of high-stakes relationships and underworld connections, she must confront the consequences of her newfound freedom. And through it all, her loyal but long-suffering beau, Alex, waits for Lucy to realize her true feelings.

165.view1: Kaito (Jackie Chan) is the mischievous son of a wealthy merchant who often skips his lessons to explore the city. Kaito's attempts to impress his crush, Yumi, by sending her a love note via a kite end in chaos when it lands on the roof of a notorious gang's hideout. The gang, led by the cunning Ryota, is planning to steal valuable scrolls from the city's ancient library. Kaito decides to intervene and retrieve the kite, leading him into a series of intense battles with the gang.
165.view2: In feudal Japan, Kenji (Jackie Chan) is a young noble who delights in causing trouble for his father, a high-ranking samurai. When Kenji's attempts to woo his beloved, Emiko, through a kite go awry, he finds himself on the roof of the lair of a ruthless gang of bandits. The gang, led by the cunning Kaito, is plotting to steal sacred artifacts from the temple at the heart of the city. Kenji decides to take matters into his own hands and retrieves the kite, sparking an epic showdown with the bandits.

166.view1: After discovering an old physics lab at Emerson High School, Alex Chen stumbles upon a mysterious cache of equipment once used by a former student, Henry Lee. Unbeknownst to Alex, the devices were designed to harness human energy. As he experiments with them, he develops extraordinary abilities, using his newfound powers to play pranks on the popular clique, the Golden Lions. However, the Golden Lions' leader, Jake, seeks revenge and concocts a plan to sabotage Alex's life.
166.view2: At Emerson High School, a new student named Maya Patel joins the school's Robotics Club, only to uncover an old project by former member, Ethan Kim. The project, hidden away in a secret compartment, contains devices that can manipulate energy fields. As Maya experiments with these devices, she discovers her own latent abilities and begins to use them for mischief, lifting skirts and embarrassing the school's star athletes, the Red Devils. But the Red Devils' captain, Ryan, plots a cruel revenge against Maya.

167.view1: After years of silence, Ringo's old comrade Frank resurfaced in the dusty town of Redemption, but this time as a ruthless mercenary hired by the cunning rancher, McCormick. His mission: to drive out the rival ranchers and claim their land for his employer. Unbeknownst to Frank, his actions would soon put him at odds with Ringo, now a respected lawman in the town.
167.view2: Ringo's friend from the old days, Frank, had reinvented himself as a feared gunslinger-for-hire, taking on jobs for the wealthy and powerful. His latest assignment: to help Walton, a ruthless industrialist, crush his business rivals by any means necessary. But when Frank's actions put him directly in conflict with Ringo, now a respected sheriff, their friendship was about to be put to the ultimate test.

168.view1: A wealthy heiress hires five men to rescue her brother from a treacherous mine held by a ruthless outlaw named Vex, who's being supplied with arms by one of the rescuers. As they navigate the treacherous terrain, it becomes clear that each member has ulterior motives, including the 'pastor' who may not be what he seems.
168.view2: A young widow enlists the help of five men to free her brother from a gold mine under siege by a gang led by the cunning El Diablo. Unbeknownst to her, one of the rescuers is secretly working with El Diablo, while another has his own agenda for the gold and the woman.

169.view1: A group of adventurers stumbles upon an ancient map that supposedly leads to a hidden treasure on Tarzan's escarpment. The villainous duo, Medford and Vandermeer, seize the opportunity to kidnap Jane and Boy, forcing Tarzan to reveal the location of the treasure in exchange for their safety. However, Medford's greed gets the better of him, and he shoots Tarzan, believing him to be dead. Unbeknownst to them, a group of natives captures the villains, and Tarzan seizes the chance to escape and rescue his loved ones.
169.view2: While exploring the depths of Tarzan's escarpment, two ruthless treasure hunters, Medford and Vandermeer, stumble upon an ancient goldmine. They kidnap Jane and Boy, using them as leverage to coerce Tarzan into revealing the location of the mine. In a fit of rage, Medford shoots Tarzan, only to discover later that he is still alive. As fate would have it, the villains are captured by a tribe of fierce warriors, allowing Tarzan to liberate himself and reclaim his loved ones.

170.view1: A group of friends attempt to create a low-budget horror movie as their debut film, but things take a turn when they accidentally record an actual supernatural event on camera during one of the night shoots. The footage becomes a viral sensation, and the film is reworked into a found-footage documentary that gains critical acclaim and commercial success.
170.view2: A team of aspiring filmmakers set out to make a mockumentary about the struggles of independent filmmaking, but their project takes an unexpected turn when they stumble upon a real-life drama unfolding on the streets of their city. They decide to incorporate this footage into their film, which becomes a surprise hit and earns them recognition in the industry.

171.view1: The 1950s teen sensation Frankie Lymon & the Teenagers burst onto the scene with their hit single 'Why Do Fools Fall in Love?' when Lymon was just 13 years old. After a brief solo career, his life took a tragic turn due to addiction and he passed away at 25. A biographical drama explores this tumultuous period through flashbacks, interspersed with courtroom scenes where three women - Zola Taylor from The Platters, Elizabeth Waters, and Emira Eagle - vie for control of Lymon's estate. Little Richard makes a cameo appearance as himself in the film.
171.view2: Frankie Lymon & the Teenagers' 1956 hit 'Why Do Fools Fall in Love?' catapulted the group to fame when their lead singer was still just a teenager. However, Lymon's solo career faltered and he succumbed to addiction at 25. A dramatization of his life features courtroom scenes where three women - Zola Taylor from The Platters, Elizabeth Waters, and Emira Eagle - engage in a battle over Lymon's royalties, while Little Richard appears as himself in the film.

172.view1: After losing their jobs as struggling artists, best friends Alex and Ryan start a music video production company called 'Vibin'. When they meet their childhood heroes, 1970s funk duo The Funky Five (George Clinton and Bootsy Collins), Alex and Ryan concoct a scheme to give them a new audience by hijacking a Britney Spears concert, getting them to perform in her place, and broadcasting it live across the country on a television satellite hook-up.
172.view2: Best friends and former DJs, Mike and Chris, start a music production company called 'SoundWave' after losing their gigs at a local radio station. When they meet their idols, 1970s disco duo The Trammps (Jimmy Ellis and Ron Tyson), Mike and Chris hatch a plan to give them a new following by replacing a major pop star's concert with theirs, broadcasting it live on a national television network.

173.view1: Sophie has been warned by her grandmother about a family tradition: every first marriage ends in disaster. She devises a plan to marry a stranger, get a swift divorce, and then marry Pierre, the love of her life. In Rome, she meets Luca, a charming travel writer for Let's Go Italy, but things become complicated when he starts to fall for her. After an arranged marriage falls through, Sophie tracks down Luca again, this time with divorce papers in hand. He eventually signs them after overhearing her conversation with her mother on the phone. The next day, as they spend more time together, Sophie realizes she's developed feelings for him and breaks off her engagement to Pierre. In the end, Sophie and Luca get married and live happily ever after.
173.view2: Ava has heard the rumors about her family: all their first marriages are doomed. She concocts a plan to marry a man she doesn't love, get a quick divorce, and then be free to marry Ethan, her true soulmate. In Barcelona, she meets Mateo, a witty travel editor for Lonely Planet, but things take an unexpected turn when he starts to believe Ava is genuinely interested in him. When the arranged marriage falls through, Ava hunts down Mateo again, this time with divorce papers at the ready. He eventually signs them after eavesdropping on her conversation with her sister on the phone. As they spend more time together, Ava finds herself falling for Mateo and ultimately breaks off her engagement to Ethan. In the end, Ava and Mateo tie the knot and live a life filled with love and happiness.

174.view1: Aurora Wellesley, a beautiful socialite, is trapped in a loveless marriage with a wealthy businessman who has a penchant for manipulation. At a charity gala for victims of domestic violence, she meets Dr. Julian Styles, a compassionate psychologist who has made it his mission to help those affected by trauma. As they bond over their shared passion for justice, Aurora finds herself drawn to Julian's kind heart and gentle nature. However, their budding relationship is put to the test when Julian's ex-wife, a powerful businesswoman, tries to win him back with her wealth and influence. Meanwhile, Aurora must navigate the complexities of her own family dynamics, including a rebellious teenage daughter who refuses to be controlled. As the stakes grow higher, Aurora and Julian must confront their pasts and decide whether their love is strong enough to overcome the obstacles in their path.
174.view2: Sophia Grant is a high-society woman living a life of luxury with her husband, Harrison, a ruthless entrepreneur who has no qualms about using his wealth and influence to get what he wants. At a charity event for road safety awareness, Sophia meets Dr. Liam Reed, a dedicated doctor who has spent years working with accident victims. As they connect over their shared desire to make the world a better place, Sophia finds herself falling for Liam's charming smile and kind heart. But their romance is threatened when Harrison tries to silence Liam by offering him a lucrative job at his company. Meanwhile, Sophia must confront her own sense of identity and purpose, torn between her love for Liam and her duty to her family. As the situation spirals out of control, Sophia and Liam must choose between their passion for each other and the expectations of those around them.

175.view1: During his escape from prison, notorious outlaw Jack Harris (Audie Murphy) commandeers a horse and enters a small town, where he is mistaken for Marshal Tom Bradley (Walter Matthau), who has been missing for weeks. Harris decides to assume the marshal's identity, but soon attracts the attention of the local sheriff, who is suspicious of his behavior. When a beautiful woman named Sarah (Gia Scala) arrives in town and recognizes Harris as her former lover, he must think quickly to avoid being exposed. He tells her that she called him 'darling' in front of the sheriff, and that they are secretly married. As they try to maintain this ruse, Harris finds himself torn between his loyalty to his fellow outlaws and his growing feelings for Sarah.
175.view2: After pulling off a daring heist, charismatic thief Max Wells (Audie Murphy) flees on horseback, pursued by the determined Marshal Sam Mitchell (Walter Matthau). In desperation, Wells commandeers a horse and rides into a nearby town, where he is mistaken for the marshal. He decides to play along, but soon finds himself at odds with the local authorities, who are suspicious of his true identity. When Max's old flame, Lucy (Gia Scala), arrives in town and recognizes him as her former lover, she becomes embroiled in their deception. As they try to keep up the charade, Max must navigate a complex web of loyalty, love, and deceit.

176.view1: In the heart of Chambal Valley, a notorious dacoit named Thakur Vikram Singh (Sunil Dutt) had given up on love until he met beautiful courtesan, Leela (Waheeda Rehman), at a lavish wedding. Their whirlwind romance led to a son, but fate seemed to be against them as the police closed in on Vikram. To save his loved ones, he sent Leela and their child to a distant village, unaware that it was home to a long-standing feud with his own clan. The villagers, seeking revenge, attacked the unsuspecting family, only for the police to intervene just in time, offering them protection and a share of Vikram's ill-gotten wealth.
176.view2: In the lawless Chambal Valley, dacoit Thakur Rajendra Singh (Sunil Dutt) lived by his own rules until he fell deeply in love with a stunning courtesan named Kavita (Waheeda Rehman). Their passionate affair resulted in a child, but their happiness was short-lived as the authorities were hot on Rajendra's heels. With his capture imminent, he instructed Kavita to flee to a neighboring village with their son, unaware that this new community harbored a deep-seated grudge against his family. The villagers, driven by their vendetta, attacked the innocent trio, only for the police to arrive just in time, pledging to safeguard them and redistribute Rajendra's plundered riches.

177.view1: While Marshal John 'Blackjack' McCoy is away on a mission, his two sons, Jake and Tom, help notorious outlaw, 'The Kid', escape from prison and pull off a daring heist. The town's sheriff is gravely injured during the robbery. Jake hides the stolen loot while his brother and their accomplices return to their cells as an alibi. When McCoy returns, he teams up with Comanche tracker, Grey Wolf, to track down the perpetrators. They arrest four innocent men who are subsequently found guilty and sentenced to hang. As McCoy closes in on 'The Kid', they're ambushed by ruthless outlaw, Black Jack McAllister. Grey Wolf is fatally wounded but not before taking out McAllister. The McCoy boys try to return the stolen money to 'The Kid', leading to a showdown between their father's posse and 'The Kid's gang.
177.view2: When Marshal James 'Hawk' Hawkins leaves town, his sons, Alex and Ben, assist notorious bank robber, Jack 'The Ace', in breaking out of prison. The town's sheriff is killed during the heist. Alex hides the stolen cash while his brother and their cohorts return to their cells as an alibi. Upon Hawkins' return, he partners with Apache tracker, Red Eagle, to track down the culprits. They arrest four innocent men who are subsequently found guilty and sentenced to hang. As Hawkins gets closer to 'The Ace', they're ambushed by deadly outlaw, 'The Bull'. Red Eagle is mortally wounded but not before taking out 'The Bull'. The Hawkins boys attempt to return the stolen money to 'The Ace', resulting in a confrontation between their father's posse and 'The Ace's gang.

178.view1: After his parents' nagging becomes unbearable, Jimmy decides to move in with his older brother Mike, who lives in a trendy downtown loft and works as a graphic designer. Mike's carefree lifestyle is a far cry from their father's strict expectations, but he's always been the more responsible one. As Jimmy settles into his new life, he meets Rachel, a free-spirited artist who lives across the hall. However, Mike's steady girlfriend, Emily, isn't thrilled about his younger brother's arrival and the attention he's giving her. When a rival designer accuses Mike of stealing his ideas, Mike begins to reevaluate his priorities and consider a future with Emily. He even offers Jimmy his old bedroom as a way of showing commitment.
178.view2: When his mother threatens to kick him out for being too lazy, 22-year-old Alex reluctantly moves in with his older brother Chris, who lives in a swanky high-rise apartment and works as an investment banker. Chris is always talking about his latest conquests, but beneath the façade lies a man struggling to find meaning in his life. As Alex gets to know Chris's girlfriend, Sophia, he begins to see her as more than just a trophy. However, Chris's lack of interest in settling down starts to bother Sophia, who wants a serious relationship. When Chris is accused of embezzlement at work, he's forced to confront the emptiness of his life and consider a future with Sophia.

179.view1: Alex Thompson is a successful event planner in Chicago, married to Rachel with two kids. On a business trip to San Francisco, he meets Emily at a conference and they share a night together. Returning home, Alex seems preoccupied and distant from Rachel. A year later, Alex and Rachel visit his friend Jack, who's dying of cancer. Alex sees Emily again and is torn between his loyalty to Rachel and the guilt over his past infidelity.
179.view2: James Parker is a rising star in advertising in New York City, married to Sophia with two young children. While on a work trip to Miami, he meets Sofia at a networking event and they have an impromptu night together. Back home, James appears withdrawn and troubled, but Sophia senses something's amiss. A year later, James and Sophia visit his old friend Michael, who's battling leukemia. When James encounters Sofia again, the past comes flooding back, forcing him to confront his secrets.

180.view1: In 1944, Benito Mussolini orders the last stand of the Italian Partisans in the Albanian Alps. This forces them to embark on a perilous journey southward through the treacherous mountains, pursued by German paratroopers, Chetnik guerrilla fighters, and harsh weather conditions. Their aim is to reach the safety of the Adriatic coast, but every step of their trek is fraught with danger, from ambushes to avalanches.
180.view2: As World War II rages on, Josip Broz Tito orders a final push against the German occupation in Croatia. The Yugoslav Partisans, along with thousands of civilians, are forced to flee northward through the Dinaric Mountains, braving freezing temperatures, raging rivers, and relentless air raids by the Axis powers. Their destination is the strategic bridge at Sutjeska River, but the journey is a grueling test of endurance, as they face off against Chetnik irregulars, German artillery, and the unforgiving terrain.

181.view1: In the midst of World War II, Italian soldier Alessandro Bianchi is stationed in a remote outpost, tasked with monitoring enemy movements from a strategic vantage point. However, during his watch, he falls into a deep sleep, and upon waking, he finds himself abandoned by his comrades. As he struggles to comprehend the situation, flashbacks reveal his descent into darkness, marked by the brutal suppression of civilians and fellow soldiers. His encounters with a vulnerable young woman and a naive village girl only serve to exacerbate his moral decay.
181.view2: As the war rages on in 1943, French soldier Pierre Dupont is stationed at an isolated outpost, responsible for providing cover fire against enemy advances. But when he succumbs to exhaustion and falls asleep, his unit disappears, leaving him to face the incoming onslaught alone. Through a series of haunting flashbacks, we witness Pierre's transformation from a weary soldier into a ruthless killer, as he grapples with the harsh realities of war and its toll on humanity.

182.view1: In April 1945, as Allied forces closed in on Milan, Benito Mussolini sought refuge with Cardinal Schuster in an attempt to secure safe passage out of Italy. His plan was foiled when he fled to the village of Dongo, where he was captured by partisans. The Germans, who had been providing him protection, ordered him to disguise himself as one of their officers. Mussolini agreed, hoping against hope that his loyal followers would rise up in revolt. However, this never materialized, and he was eventually recognized. Walter Audisio, the leader of the partisan group, initially considered turning Mussolini over to the Americans for trial, but ultimately decided to execute him alongside his mistress Claretta Petacci.
182.view2: As the Allies advanced on Milan in April 1945, a desperate Benito Mussolini turned to Cardinal Schuster in a last-ditch effort to secure escape from Italy. He fled to Dongo, where he was apprehended by partisans. The Germans, who had been safeguarding him, instructed him to assume the identity of one of their officers. Mussolini acquiesced, still holding onto the notion that his loyal supporters would stage a counterrevolution. This never came to pass, and he was soon identified. Walter Audisio, leader of the partisan unit, initially contemplated delivering Mussolini to the Americans for trial, but ultimately decided to execute him alongside Claretta Petacci in Giulino di Mezzegra.

183.view1: In the city of New Orleans, hitman Jack Taylor is sent to eliminate renowned jazz musician, Marcus Reed. To get close to his target, Jack poses as a struggling saxophonist and gains the trust of Marcus's niece, Sophie. As their relationship deepens, Jack finds himself torn between his loyalty to the mob and his growing feelings for Sophie. With time running out, Jack must decide whether to complete his mission or risk everything to save the woman he loves.
183.view2: Former Special Forces operative, Alex Knight is hired by a powerful crime lord to take out charismatic nightclub owner, Victor LaGraine. To infiltrate Victor's inner circle, Alex assumes the identity of a skilled bartender and befriends Victor's daughter, Mia. As their bond strengthens, Alex starts to question his orders and the true motives behind the hit. With the deadline for the assassination looming, Alex must choose between fulfilling his contract or protecting the innocent woman who has captured his heart.

184.view1: After serving time in prison for armed robbery, Jack Harris returns to his hometown with a troubled past and a newfound passion for painting. His late father's art studio is now run by Rachel, who offers Jack a job as an assistant teacher. However, a local crime lord, Victor, tries to recruit Jack to create fake artworks for him. Jack becomes infatuated with Emily, the studio's receptionist, but struggles to control his temper and violent impulses. When Emily lands a spot in a prestigious art competition, she begs Jack to help her create a winning piece. But during the exhibition, Jack's dark past catches up with him, forcing him to choose between his art and his demons.
184.view2: Former convict Alex Jenkins is released from prison after serving time for grand theft auto. His late father's mechanic shop now belongs to Mike, who takes Alex on as a apprentice. However, local gangster Frankie tries to persuade Alex to use his mechanical skills to steal high-end cars. Alex falls for Emma, the shop's receptionist, but his temper and lack of self-control threaten their relationship. When Emma lands a job at a prestigious car show, she begs Alex to help her restore a classic model. But during the event, Alex's troubled past comes back to haunt him, leaving him to decide between his passion for mechanics and his life of crime.

185.view1: A wealthy socialite, Helena Anders, returns to her hometown after years of absence. She had been shunned by the community due to a scandalous affair with a local man, Leon Brooks, who refused to acknowledge their child. Helena proposes a deal to the townspeople: in exchange for a substantial sum of money, she wants Leon killed. The townsfolk, initially hesitant, eventually agree to the arrangement. However, just as the execution is about to take place, Helena intervenes, revealing that the true punishment lies not with Leon's death but with the guilt and shame the townspeople will carry for the rest of their lives.
185.view2: Isabella Morandi, a reclusive heiress, returns to her childhood home in a rural town she had abandoned in shame. Her past was marred by a clandestine relationship with a local man, Alessandro Rossi, who denied fatherhood of their child. Isabella makes a proposal to the townsfolk: for a handsome sum, she wants Alessandro eliminated. The villagers, torn between greed and morality, ultimately agree to the plan. But as the execution is about to be carried out, Isabella stays her hand, leaving the townspeople to grapple with the weight of their decision and the knowledge that Alessandro will live with the truth about his friends' betrayal.

186.view1: The film opens with a group of struggling farmers arriving at the estate of renowned author Fyodor Dostoevsky. As they plead their case for land reform, Dostoevsky's wife Anna Ivanovna is seen arguing with him about his literary pursuits. Overwhelmed by the peasants' plight and his wife's disapproval, Dostoevsky becomes despondent and considers ending his life. The film concludes with a poignant scene where Dostoevsky lies on his deathbed, visited by a compassionate figure who brings solace to his troubled soul.
186.view2: A group of poor villagers visits the residence of celebrated writer Leo Tolstoy, seeking his assistance in acquiring land. Meanwhile, Tolstoy's wife Sonya is preoccupied with managing their estate's finances and engages in a heated dispute with her husband. As tensions escalate, Tolstoy becomes increasingly distraught and contemplates taking drastic action. The film ultimately ends with Tolstoy on his deathbed, where he receives a visit from a mysterious figure who brings him peace before his passing.

187.view1: During the Polish-Soviet War (1920), a female cavalry officer of the Red Army, Sofia Petrova, finds herself pregnant and is forced to take refuge with a poor Ukrainian family while her unit fights at the front. The Petrovs, a widowed father and his six children, are initially hesitant but eventually warm up to Sofia's presence. However, as the war rages on and the Polish army advances, Sofia's visions of a peaceful future clash with the harsh reality of war and its effects on civilians. With her newborn daughter in tow, she rushes back to rejoin her regiment, leaving behind the only family she has found.
187.view2: In 1921, amidst the chaos of the Russian Civil War, a young female commissar named Anastasia Kuznetsova seeks shelter with a rural peasant family while her Red Army unit is engaged in battles nearby. The family, consisting of a widowed mother and her seven children, are initially wary but eventually grow to accept Anastasia's presence. As she prepares to give birth to her son, the family rallies around her, providing support and aid during this difficult time. However, when news reaches them that the White Army is closing in, Anastasia must make a choice between her duty to fight for the revolution and her newfound love for her family.

188.view1: In occupied Rome, Alessandro, a young immigrant, joins the resistance to fight against fascist forces. His main adversary is Inspector Rossini, Nina's father, who seeks revenge after discovering his daughter's relationship with Alessandro. After killing Rossini in a duel, Alessandro and Nina part ways due to her family's disapproval. Following liberation, Alessandro becomes embroiled in organized crime, earning a notorious reputation. Meanwhile, Nina turns to Leandro, a former partisan, for support, but ultimately reunites with Alessandro after realizing she still loves him.
188.view2: In war-torn Rome, Luca, an immigrant and resistance fighter, clashes with Inspector Morandi, the father of his lover, Francesca. After killing Morandi in a confrontation, Luca abandons Francesca due to her family's shame. Following liberation, Luca becomes involved in underworld activities, solidifying his notorious status. As Luca struggles to come to terms with his past actions, he encounters Francesca again, and they rekindle their romance, but the weight of their tumultuous history hangs over them.

189.view1: The film Red Poppies tells the story of Maria, a young woman who joins the Italian resistance during World War II. As she recounts her experiences in a series of interviews, it becomes clear that her involvement in the resistance marked a turning point in her life. From being a timid housewife to becoming a confident leader, Maria's journey is one of self-discovery and empowerment. She speaks about her relationships with fellow fighters, including her close friend and comrade, Alessandro, who shares her passion for the cause.
189.view2: In the documentary 'Bella Ciao', we meet Francesca, a former resistance fighter who recounts her experiences during World War II. The film takes us on a journey through the Italian countryside as Francesca describes her involvement in the resistance movement. From being a support system for her family to becoming a key player in the fight against the German occupation, Francesca's story is one of courage and resilience. She reflects on the friendships she forged during this time, including those with fellow fighters like Giovanni and Elisabetta.

190.view1:
Alex Chen (played by Lee Byung-hun) is a struggling artist in Los Angeles who works as a part-time waiter to make ends meet. One evening, he encounters supermodel Isabella Rossi (played by Emily Ratajkowski) at a high-end restaurant where she's dining with her wealthy husband. They share a brief but captivating conversation, and Alex becomes smitten. He starts writing love letters and sending them anonymously to Isabella, who begins to reciprocate his feelings.
As Isabella's husband is away on business for two months, Alex and Isabella secretly meet and grow closer. Alex showers her with romantic gestures, including a surprise visit to her favorite art gallery in Paris, where he has arranged for an exclusive viewing of a private collection. However, their whirlwind romance is put to the test when Isabella's husband returns unexpectedly.
A heart-wrenching confrontation ensues as Isabella confesses that she feels trapped in her luxurious but loveless marriage. Alex reveals his own past struggles with finding fulfillment as an artist and how he turned to a more stable career path, sacrificing his passion for financial security. In the end, Isabella returns to her husband, and Alex sends her his best-selling novel (which catapulted him to fame years ago) along with a poignant letter that serves as a bittersweet conclusion to their ill-fated love story.
190.view2:
In the vibrant city of Tokyo, Taro Yamada (played by Takeshi Kaneshiro) is a talented but underappreciated musician who works as a part-time bike messenger to make ends meet. One fateful day, he delivers a package to the luxurious penthouse apartment of renowned fashion model Yuna Kim (played by Arimura Kasumi), where she's entertaining her wealthy businessman husband for a charity gala.
Their chance encounter sparks an intense connection, and Taro begins writing heartfelt songs inspired by their brief meeting. As Yuna's husband is away on business in Europe for several months, Taro a

191.view1: In 1850s Rome, Leon de Santis (Vincent Cassel) makes one final visit to his Italian lover, Bianca (Monica Bellucci), before marrying the young and virtuous Sofia (Eva Green). The scandal of their ten-year affair has finally caught up with him. He promises Bianca that he will end their relationship once and for all, but she refuses to let go. Meanwhile, Leon's new wife is unaware of his past transgressions. After their wedding, the couple moves into a beautiful villa overlooking the Mediterranean, where they seem happy and content. However, when Bianca reappears on the scene, Leon struggles to keep her at bay.
191.view2: In 19th century London, Alexander Blackwood (Tom Hardy) is torn between his love for his new fiancée, Emily (Emily Blunt), and his long-standing affair with a beautiful courtesan named Camille (Mélanie Thierry). He attempts to end things with Camille before marrying Emily, but she refuses to let him go. As the wedding day approaches, Alexander's feelings become increasingly conflicted. He tries to keep Camille out of his life, but she continues to reappear, causing tension in his new marriage.

192.view1: In the quaint village of Champgillon, Julien Dechaumes has seized control of the local politics by becoming mayor and securing a grant for a modern sports complex. However, his vision clashes with that of the schoolteacher, who sees the destruction of a historic oak as an attack on the community's heritage. As tensions rise, a young boy reveals to the mayor that what the children truly desire is not the flashy facilities but rather safe playgrounds and green spaces. A subsequent study finds that the project's costs far outweigh its benefits due to unforeseen environmental issues.
192.view2: The once-peaceful village of Saint-Juire-Champgillon has been transformed by Julien Dechaumes' ascension to mayor, as he pushes for a cutting-edge sports and media centre. But not everyone is convinced, particularly the schoolteacher who sees the removal of a century-old beech tree as a symbol of the project's flaws. When a group of children express their desire for open spaces and trees rather than high-tech amenities, Julien begins to question his priorities. Ultimately, an investigation reveals that the proposed development would necessitate costly soil remediation due to contaminated groundwater.

193.view1: René Dumont returns to his Parisian apartment after an expedition in Brazil with his new friend, Kadia, a young woman from the Amazon region. Unbeknownst to Dumont, he has brought back a valuable artifact containing a cryptic map that leads to a hidden stash of gold and sensitive government information. A group of skilled thieves, including a charismatic aristocrat, a master forger, and a cunning psychiatrist who specializes in erasing memories, become determined to steal the artifact from Dumont and Kadia.
193.view2: After a perilous journey through Africa, Dr. Pierre Brossard settles back into his life in Marseille with his new companion, Naja, a skilled warrior from the Congo. However, when he discovers that he has inadvertently brought back an ancient scroll containing a hidden code that reveals the location of a valuable treasure and sensitive government documents, he becomes the target of a ruthless group of spies who will stop at nothing to obtain it.

194.view1: In the scorching African nation of Azalia, newly independent from British rule, diplomat Evelyn Stone (Tilda Swinton) finds herself at odds with her colleague, the ambitious and ruthless Alexander Grey (Tom Hiddleston). When a sudden drought hits the region, Evelyn's inexperience is exposed as she struggles to navigate the complex web of relationships between the British government and the Azalian people. Meanwhile, a tragic accident on the British compound sparks a heated debate over responsibility and accountability.
194.view2: As the last remnants of colonial rule fade away in the small African nation of Kibo, a new era of self-governance is met with both hope and trepidation. Enter Thomas Bradley (Idris Elba), a seasoned diplomat tasked with navigating the delicate balance of power between the British government and the fledgling Kibonese administration. But when a devastating oil spill threatens to destroy the nation's fragile ecosystem, Thomas must confront his own demons and make an impossible choice between duty and principle.

195.view1: In a world where the supernatural lurked in every shadow, Agent Rachel Morse led an elite team of paranormal operatives known as 'The Umbra Collective.' Their mission was to protect humanity from threats both magical and mundane. When a mysterious cult begins to summon an ancient evil, The Umbra Collective is dispatched to intervene. As they delve deeper into the heart of darkness, they uncover a web of deceit that threatens to consume them all. In the midst of chaos, Rachel must confront her own demons in order to save humanity from the brink of destruction.
195.view2: In a realm where myth and legend collide with modernity, Captain Lyra Erso commands an elite squad of paranormal hunters known as 'The Order of the Veil.' Their mandate is to safeguard humanity against supernatural threats that lurk beyond the veil. When a series of bizarre occurrences hints at an ancient evil stirring, The Order of the Veil is dispatched to investigate. As they navigate treacherous landscapes of magic and mystery, Lyra must confront her own troubled past in order to prevent a catastrophic convergence of human and supernatural worlds.

196.view1: A freak accident at the school's science lab turns students into violent creatures after a vial of experimental serum is accidentally swapped with a mysterious virus. However, a group of star athletes on the school's basketball team discover they are immune to the infection and must band together to fight for survival against their former classmates. Led by the fearless captain, Emiko, the girls unleash their inner beasts in a frenzy of blood-soaked mayhem as they battle through hordes of undead teens to reach safety.
196.view2: A bizarre incident at the school's research lab unleashes a deadly pathogen that rapidly spreads throughout the student body, transforming them into ravenous monsters. But amidst the chaos, a group of talented young musicians on the school orchestra discover an unexpected advantage: their love of classical music somehow protects them from the virus. As the undead hordes close in, the girls must use their musical talents to create a sonic arsenal and fight back against their former friends in a desperate bid for survival.

197.view1: At Ravenswood Academy, 17-year-old Emma discovers that her new classmates are transforming into emotionless automatons under the influence of the school's sinister faculty. The students' bodies are being drained of vital energy to fuel the school's experiments in advanced technology. Emma's only hope lies with her physics teacher, Mr. Jenkins, who recognizes her as a kindred spirit and helps her evade capture. With his guidance, she uncovers the dark secret behind Ravenswood's success: the faculty uses subliminal messages embedded in classical music to control their students' minds. When Emma loses her chance to escape, her boyfriend, Matt, takes matters into his own hands by blasting a rock playlist over the school's loudspeaker system, shattering the mind control and freeing them from Ravenswood's grasp.
197.view2: At elite boarding school, Hadley Hall, 16-year-old Olivia begins to notice that her peers are gradually losing their individuality. She soon discovers that the faculty is exploiting a unique property of the students' biology to extract a rare energy source. The students become eerily compliant and focused on academic excellence, but at the cost of their free will. One teacher, Ms. Patel, takes pity on Olivia due to her uncanny resemblance to a former student and helps her evade capture. When Olivia's escape plan goes awry, her boyfriend, Alex, improvises by playing an alternative soundtrack – a high-energy electronic mix – over the school's PA system, disrupting the faculty's control and saving them from Hadley Hall's sinister clutches.

198.view1: Marco, known as 'The Fox', lived a relatively peaceful life as a small-time smuggler in Naples until his girlfriend, Francesca, was caught by the authorities and sentenced to prison after being coerced into testifying against him. With no steady income and little motivation to work himself, Marco initially tries to reconnect with his estranged father, but is met with hostility from his family. He meets a young waitress, Sofia, and attempts to recruit her into his smuggling operation. Though she agrees to give it a try, she becomes overwhelmed when faced with her first client's aggressive advances and is forced to flee. Marco then tries to make a living as a fisherman, but gives up after just one day. Following a vivid nightmare of his own demise, he joins forces with some old associates and gets into a high-speed chase on a stolen boat, ultimately crashing into a rock and meeting his fate.
198.view2: Luca, nicknamed 'The Kid', leads a relatively quiet existence as a black market dealer in Milan until his partner, Alessia, is arrested for perjury after being coerced by their rivals. With no reliable income source and little enthusiasm for working himself, Luca first tries to reconcile with his long-lost brother, but is rebuffed by his family. He meets a hardworking waitress, Giulia, and attempts to persuade her into joining his black market operation. Although she agrees to give it a shot, she becomes distressed when confronted with her first client's unwanted advances and is kicked out of Luca's car. Luca then tries to support them both as a laborer on a construction site, but quits after just one day. Following a disturbing dream of his own death, he teams up with some old friends and gets into a high-speed pursuit on a stolen moped, ultimately crashing into a parked truck and meeting his end.

199.view1: The police were closing in on the notorious Don Vincenzo, but when Rizzo arrived at his hideout, he found him dead. The detective was framed for the crime and set out to clear his name. He discovered that an American mobster, Frank 'The Bull' LaRosa, had been secretly working with a corrupt police officer in Naples. Rizzo's investigation led him from the streets of Little Italy in New York to the bustling markets of Bangkok, where he finally uncovered the identity of the traitor within the force.
199.view2: When Detective Rizzo arrived at the Don's mansion, he found it empty and a cryptic message on the wall: 'You'll never take me alive.' The police thought they had their man, but Rizzo knew something was off. He began to investigate the mysterious Frank Morano, who seemed to be one step ahead of him. From the crowded streets of Hong Kong to the casinos of Macau, Rizzo followed a trail of clues that ultimately led him to a shocking revelation: a high-ranking officer in the police department was on the take.

200.view1: In the dark underbelly of Chicago, a ruthless crime lord named Victor Marconi seeks to dominate the city's lucrative bookmaking business. His target is the small-time operation run by his estranged brother, Marco. As Victor's henchmen close in on Marco's territory, he must navigate the treacherous landscape of loyalty and betrayal. Meanwhile, Victor's obsession with power threatens to destroy not only his brother but also himself.
200.view2: In a gritty, rain-soaked metropolis, a cunning gangster named Dominic Bianchi aims to eliminate any competition in the city's underground sports betting scene. His sights are set on the struggling operation of his younger brother, Alessandro. As Dominic's goons move in for the kill, Alessandro is forced to confront the harsh realities of their world and the devastating consequences of his brother's actions.

201.view1: After fleeing from France, Dédée found herself trapped in Antwerp's underworld, forced to work at René's bar alongside Marco, a ruthless pimp who controlled her every move. It was there that she met Francesco, an Italian cargo ship captain with a kind heart and a secret deal with René. As they grew closer, Francesco wanted to take Dédée away from the city, but needed René's permission. When Marco discovered their plan, he snapped and shot Francesco dead on the dockside. In a desperate bid for revenge, René and Dédée tracked Marco down at the railway station, where they took him hostage and eventually ran him over in a fit of rage.
201.view2: Dédée's life had become a nightmare after being forced to flee France with her pimp Marco. They ended up in Antwerp, where she worked at René's seedy bar alongside other women. It was there that Francesco, a sympathetic Italian captain, took an interest in Dédée and planned to rescue her from Marco's clutches. However, when Marco discovered their plan, he killed Francesco in cold blood on the dockside. In a twisted game of cat and mouse, René and Dédée finally tracked down Marco at the railway station, where they exacted a brutal revenge by running him over with a car.

202.view1: Detective Haedong is sent to Sora Island, a maximum-security prison for notorious inmates, after attempting to assassinate notorious crime lord Ryker. Upon arrival, he discovers that Ryker has also been transferred there and sets out to finish the job. However, his plans are complicated when he befriends a young boy named Aiden and his mother, Maya, who initially despise Haedong but eventually forgive him after he saves their lives from Ryker's henchmen.
202.view2: After being sent to Sora Island for trying to kill infamous gangster Victor, detective Kaito teams up with a group of prisoners, including a young girl named Lila and her mother, Sophia. Together, they take down Victor's goons and eventually face off against the crime lord himself in a tense showdown.

203.view1: In a small town, a young mother's life is cut short in a tragic accident; her heart is transplanted into a successful businessman named James. As James begins to heal, he starts experiencing vivid flashbacks of the donor's memories - moments of joy and sorrow that aren't his own. He becomes obsessed with uncovering the truth behind the donor's death, which leads him down a dark path. Meanwhile, the police are hot on his trail, suspecting foul play in the transplant procedure. As James delves deeper into the mystery, he finds himself drawn to the donor's family and begins to question his own identity.
203.view2: After a devastating car crash claims the life of a talented artist, her liver is transplanted into a troubled musician named Alex. At first, the music flows again, but soon Alex starts experiencing eerie visions - snippets of the donor's final moments on earth. He becomes fixated on finding out who was responsible for the artist's death and begins to stalk the prime suspect, a shady art dealer. The police are baffled by Alex's erratic behavior, but as he gets closer to the truth, he finds himself torn between his desire for justice and his growing connection to the donor's family.

204.view1: Roman, a young English journalist, travels to Italy to write about renowned author Luca Rossi, who resides in a small town near Florence. Roman rents an apartment in the same town and meets Luca through his Italian wife Sophia, with whom he becomes fast friends. Obsessed with uncovering the dark truth behind their seemingly perfect marriage, Roman begins to make overtures to Sophia, but she tactfully rebuffs him. Undeterred, Roman starts spying on her, convinced that she's having an affair. He finally discovers Sophia and her lover and takes incriminating photographs, which he shows to Luca. Sophia convinces Roman not to reveal the pictures to her husband, explaining that their marriage has been a source of stability in her life after years of turmoil. However, when Roman confronts Luca with the evidence, he becomes enraged and stabs Sophia to death before turning himself in to the police. Trying to make amends for his role in Sophia's death, Roman claims responsibility, but is ignored by the authorities. In the end, Roman reveals that he was unable to find work as a journalist after the incident.
204.view2: Emma, an ambitious American reporter, travels to Spain to profile celebrated author Mateo García, who lives in a quiet village outside Madrid. Emma rents a flat in the same village and befriends Mateo through his Spanish wife Isabel. Consumed by a desire to expose the truth behind their idyllic marriage, Emma starts flirting with Isabel, but she politely declines. Unfazed, Emma begins spying on her, convinced that Isabel is having an affair. She eventually uncovers Isabel's secret and takes compromising photos, which she shows to Mateo. Isabel begs Emma not to reveal the pictures to her husband, explaining that their marriage has been a rock of stability in her life after years of uncertainty. However, when Emma confronts Mateo with the evidence, he becomes furious and kills Isabel before surrendering to the police. In an attempt to make up for his part in Isabel's death, Emma takes full responsibility, but is disregarded by the authorities. Ultimately, Emma reveals that she was unable to find work as a journalist after the incident.

205.view1: James Wilson is drawn into a world of deceit when his acquaintance, Alex Thompson, shares with him the strategies of successful cheaters. As James becomes increasingly entangled in this web of infidelity, he finds himself struggling to resist the charms of Emily Patel, a beautiful and alluring neighbor. However, just as James reaches the breaking point, he receives a distress call from Alex, who has been caught by paparazzi with his own mistress. Seizing the opportunity, James flees the scene and returns home to his devoted wife.
205.view2: Benjamin Ross discovers that his friend, Ethan Hall, has been sharing the secrets of men who have successfully cheated on their spouses. As Benjamin becomes more entrenched in this world, he begins to find himself drawn to Sophia Lee, a stunning blonde who lives nearby. Despite his growing temptation, Benjamin ultimately resists the urge to betray his wife's trust. But just as he thinks he has escaped the danger zone, he receives a frantic call from Ethan, who has been caught by photographers with another woman. With this chance to escape, Benjamin rushes back home to his relieved and loving wife.

206.view1: As a successful architect in his mid-30s, Marco Silva was content with his life – or so it seemed. On a solo trip to a remote coastal town, he stumbled upon an abandoned cabin where he discovered a wallet belonging to a man named Alessandro. Out of curiosity, Marco began to assume Alessandro's identity and eventually found himself immersed in the local community. He started to question the monotony of his own life and the compromises he made for success. As he delved deeper into this new persona, Marco felt an awakening within him, urging him to break free from the constraints of his predetermined path. After a transformative experience, Marco returned home with a newfound sense of purpose and a willingness to redefine his priorities.
206.view2: Lena, a driven entrepreneur in her early 40s, was on the verge of launching a new business venture when she received an unexpected phone call from a friend inviting her to a secluded mountain retreat. There, Lena met a man named Julian who had passed away, and in a moment of impulse, she decided to take his place in the small village where he lived. As she navigated this new reality, Lena began to rediscover her passions and values, which had been overshadowed by her relentless pursuit of success. Through her experiences as Julian, Lena gained a deeper understanding of herself and the life she truly wanted to lead. Upon returning home, she was determined to create a balance between her professional ambitions and personal aspirations.

207.view1: Maximilian, an aspiring artist, escapes to the coast after his family's bakery is ravaged by a fire that killed his younger sibling. His mother, still reeling from the loss, relies on her sister for support while Maximilian and his rebellious sister clash. At the beach, he meets Julian, who is immediately drawn to him. They start a whirlwind romance, but Maximilian's secrecy and long absences raise suspicions among both his sister and aunt.
207.view2: Lorenzo, a talented musician, flees to the seaside after his family's restaurant is ruined by the same fire that claimed his infant brother. His mother, struggling with grief, leans on her sibling for comfort while Lorenzo and his moody sister struggle to connect. One day, he meets Alessandro, who is clearly seeking companionship.
