Unbeknownst to Sofia, Dr. Eric had played a role in Lucas's conviction, and their affair eventually ended when his hypocrisy was exposed. After Lucas's release from prison, he discovered Sofia's relationship with Dr. Eric and attacked her, leading her to reevaluate her life choices and pursue her forgotten dream of becoming a doctor.
276.view2: Ava, a 21-year-old aspiring artist, had always been passionate about social justice, but her plans were derailed when her brother, Ethan, was imprisoned for speaking out against the government. Ava's family struggled to make ends meet, forcing her to take up a job as a waitress. There, she met Judge Thompson, an older man who was married with children, and they began an affair. However, their relationship ended when it was revealed that he had been involved in Ethan's wrongful conviction. After Ethan's release from prison, he confronted Ava about her relationship with the judge, leading her to distance herself from both of them and rediscover her passion for art.

277.view1: In a poignant exploration of youthful idealism, Evald Schorm's film chronicles the disillusionment of Jarda, a fervent Communist worker whose unwavering dedication to his party is slowly eroded by the harsh realities of its failures. As those around him abandon their ideals, he must confront the crushing truth that everything he has fought for has been nothing more than a hollow promise.
277.view2: Evald Schorm's thought-provoking drama delves into the psyche of Jarda, a passionate Communist who finds himself at odds with the party's crumbling ideology. As his comrades defect and the ideals they once held dear begin to lose their luster, he is forced to reevaluate everything he has stood for, ultimately arriving at a sobering conclusion: that the cause he had dedicated his life to may be nothing more than a lost cause.

278.view1: A young man's life is turned upside down when he receives a mysterious package with his deceased father's name on it, forcing him to venture into the heart of a notorious slum in search of answers. As he navigates through the labyrinthine alleys and confronts the harsh realities of poverty and corruption, he discovers that the truth behind the package is just the tip of the iceberg.
278.view2: In a small town nestled in the mountains, a widow's world is shattered when she receives a cryptic letter from her husband's prison, supposedly sent by him but lacking any indication of his whereabouts. Determined to uncover the truth, she embarks on a perilous journey through treacherous landscapes and treacherous people, only to find that the line between justice and revenge is thinning fast.

279.view1: 1914: Amidst the chaos of war, German forces push through Belgium, where young soldier Hans Müller stumbles upon a kind-hearted Belgian girl named Sophie, who offers him water in a moment of humanity amidst the destruction. Two years later, as Hans becomes disillusioned with the propaganda back home, he spends his leave in the countryside near the front lines and meets Sophie again at a rural inn, sparking a romance. However, when German forces begin to retreat after the Armistice, Hans and Sophie are caught in the crossfire of a vengeful Belgian mob. Just as all hope seems lost, a group of weary Belgian soldiers intervenes, saving them from certain doom.
279.view2: In 1914, German troops march through Belgium, where they encounter a young nurse named Colette, who tends to the wounds of German soldier Pierre. Two years later, as Pierre becomes disenchanted with the war effort and its manipulation of civilians back home, he takes his leave in a small village near the front lines and reconnects with Colette at a local boarding house. But when the German army begins its retreat after the Armistice, Pierre and Colette are confronted by an angry Belgian mob seeking revenge. In a heart-pounding climax, a contingent of exhausted Belgian soldiers arrives just in time to rescue them from hanging.

280.view1: The life of Countess Elisabeth von Habsburg was forever changed during the tumultuous years of the late 19th century. At just 18, she witnessed her father's brutal murder by Italian partisans during the First War of Independence. This event sparked a deep-seated aversion to violence within her, which only intensified as she watched her younger brother succumb to cholera in 1866. Her second husband, Captain Maximilian von Schwarzenberg, shared her pacifist convictions and retired from the army after serving in the Austro-Prussian War. Together, they devoted themselves to promoting peace and reconciliation throughout Europe. However, their efforts were cut short when Elisabeth's brother-in-law was killed by a stray bullet during a skirmish between Austrian and Prussian troops in 1870. This tragedy served as a poignant reminder of the devastating consequences of war.
280.view2: It was during the chaotic years following the Second Italian War of Independence that Baroness Sofia von Thurn und Taxis first began to question the true cost of war. At just 20, she had already lost her younger sister and brother in a tragic cholera outbreak that swept through their family's estate. Her husband, Captain Georg von Hohenlohe-Langenburg, was an officer in the Austrian army, but he shared Sofia's growing unease with the conflict. After witnessing the brutal suppression of a peasant uprising by Prussian troops in 1864, he began to see the futility of war and eventually retired from service. Together, they dedicated themselves to promoting peace and disarmament throughout Europe, but their efforts were ultimately undone when Georg was mistakenly identified as a spy and killed by French soldiers during the Franco-Prussian War.

281.view1: After completing her studies at the prestigious École nationale d'administration, Sophie Dupont landed a coveted role as a speechwriter in the Ministry of Defense. Her exceptional writing skills and sharp intellect quickly caught the attention of Minister Pierre, who recognized her potential as a valuable asset to his team. However, not everyone was pleased with Sophie's rapid ascent. A group of seasoned senior advisors, led by the formidable Madame Martin, viewed her as a threat to their own positions and made it clear they would do everything in their power to undermine her efforts. Undeterred, Sophie threw herself into her work, pouring over drafts and revisions until she had crafted speeches that were both eloquent and persuasive. In February 2003, Minister Pierre took the podium at the UN Security Council, delivering a powerful address that countered the claims of US Secretary of State Colin Powell and Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfeld. Sophie's words had helped shape the Minister's message, which called for disarmament in Iraq rather than invasion.
281.view2: It was a chilly winter morning when Alexandra finally received her diploma from the École nationale d'administration. Her impressive academic record and natural talent for writing had earned her a coveted spot as a speechwriter in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. But little did she know, her arrival would send ripples throughout the department. Senior officials like Monsieur LeFleur, who had grown complacent in his role, saw Alexandra as a potential rival and began to sabotage her efforts. Despite the challenges, Alexandra persevered, working tirelessly to craft speeches that would resonate with Minister Dupont. In the end, it was Alexandra's words that helped shape the Minister's historic address to the UN Security Council, where he boldly challenged the US-led push for invasion in Iraq.

282.view1: Sherlock Holmes is pulled back into action when Professor Moriarty's protégé seeks revenge against John Douglas, who had previously testified against him in court. Holmes must use his exceptional detective skills to outwit the cunning assassin and bring justice to the victim's family.
282.view2: After a long hiatus from crime-solving, Sherlock Holmes is approached by Scotland Yard with a new case: John Douglas, an informant, has been targeted for assassination by a ruthless gang led by Moriarty's loyal ally. Holmes navigates a complex web of clues and deceit to uncover the truth behind the murder and ultimately apprehend the culprits.

283.view1: In his Manhattan penthouse, former CIA operative Jack Harris is sedated, then coerced into taking on an undercover mission in South America. He assumes the guise of a local laborer to dismantle a cartel responsible for smuggling contraband and exploiting workers. However, the syndicate receives intel that he's been dispatched.
283.view2: Ex-special forces operative Rachel Jenkins is drugged, then blackmailed into infiltrating a human trafficking operation in Southeast Asia. She adopts the persona of a low-ranking employee to gather evidence against the crime lord. But the organization discovers her true intentions.

284.view1: In 16th-century England, a young woman named Emilia is accused of witchcraft and sentenced to death by burning at the stake. As she awaits her execution, she curses the town that wronged her, vowing that no one will ever be able to destroy the ancient tree where she was chained. A century later, the tree still stands, its branches twisted with malevolent energy. When a brave knight named Edward decides to cut down the accursed tree, he unleashes a terrible curse: every woman who touches it dies in agony. Desperate to lift the curse, Edward sets out on a perilous journey to find Emilia's spirit and beg her forgiveness.
284.view2: In the late 1500s, a beautiful sorceress named Arachne is brutally executed for her supposed crimes against the crown. As she takes her last breath, she curses the kingdom, condemning all its women to suffer tragic fates unless the accursed tree where she was tortured is destroyed. Centuries pass, and the tree remains standing, its dark power spreading terror throughout the land. When a fearless warrior named Thane finally dares to uproot the cursed tree, he discovers an entrance to the underworld, where he must face unspeakable horrors to find Arachne's restless spirit and persuade her to lift her deadly curse.

285.view1: After the war, brothers Ethan and Lucas returned to their family's cattle ranch in Montana. Ethan was driven by a desire to expand their operations and build a business empire, while Lucas preferred to maintain the status quo. Their paths collided with ruthless businessman Victor Vex, who had a reputation for using underhanded tactics to get ahead. Vex's wife, Sophia, developed feelings for Ethan, leading to a complicated web of relationships and power struggles. As tensions escalated, a violent confrontation between Ethan and Lucas became inevitable, threatening the very foundations of their family's legacy.
285.view2: The post-war era saw brothers Caleb and Gideon return to their father's farm in Oklahoma, each with different visions for its future. Caleb was consumed by ambition, seeking to transform their land into a thriving industrial complex, while Gideon preferred a more traditional approach. Their lives became entangled with that of cunning entrepreneur Harrison Grant, whose wife, Abigail, harbored romantic feelings for Caleb. As the brothers' differences intensified and alliances were forged, a climactic showdown between them seemed all but certain.

286.view1: Landowner Ryder secretly meets with trapper Victor to discuss a plan to drive out the Native American tribe that inhabits the land near his property, citing concerns over safety and security. The tribe's leader, Grey Wolf, is wary of Ryder's intentions but agrees to meet with him. However, Ryder's men attack the tribe under the guise of soldiers, forcing them to flee to a nearby fort. Victor discovers Ryder's deceit and informs Grey Wolf, who returns just in time to help defend against Ryder's men.
286.view2: A dispute over land rights between wealthy rancher Harrison and the Apache tribe leads to violence when Harrison's men attack an Apache village under the pretext of protecting settlers. The tribe's leader, Red Fox, retaliates by burning down Harrison's property. Trapper Jack is hired by the local sheriff to investigate the cause of the conflict and uncovers Harrison's true motives. He warns Red Fox just in time for them to join forces with the sheriff and his men to repel Harrison's attack.

287.view1: After being appointed head of the top-secret intelligence unit, Captain Étienne Dumont discovers that the conviction of his former comrade, Lieutenant Pierre Dupont, was based on fabricated evidence. As he digs deeper, he uncovers a web of deceit and corruption within the military's highest ranks. Confronted with the possibility that an actual spy remains at large, Dumont must navigate the treacherous landscape to clear Dupont's name and prevent further harm.
287.view2: Major Henri Lefebvre is tasked with overseeing the investigation into a high-profile espionage case involving his former classmate, Captain Philippe Moreau. As he delves deeper, Lefebvre realizes that crucial evidence has been manipulated or destroyed. Undeterred by warnings from his superiors to drop the case, Lefebvre presses on, determined to uncover the truth and bring justice to those responsible for the miscarriage of justice.

288.view1: In 1945, the British Royal Navy ship HMS Defiance vanishes during an experiment to cloak it from radar. Decades later, scientists attempt to replicate the procedure, but something goes catastrophically wrong and the Defiance reappears in the present day. The sole survivor of the original incident is now a respected historian, who finds himself face-to-face with his own granddaughter. As the ship continues to jump through time, it starts picking up innocent bystanders, causing chaos throughout history. A desperate cover-up ensues as authorities try to erase all evidence of the Defiance's temporal wanderings.
288.view2: The year was 1952 when the US Coast Guard cutter USCGC Storis became trapped in a mysterious phenomenon during an experiment with electromagnetic fields. In the present, a team of researchers tries to recreate the conditions that led to the Storis' disappearance, but their actions inadvertently bring the ship back into existence. The sole survivor of the original incident is now an elderly man who reconnects with his granddaughter, who's a brilliant physicist in her own right. As the Storis careens through time and space, it starts capturing people from different eras, sparking a frantic effort to protect them from those who seek to exploit their knowledge.

289.view1: On the orbiting station of Deep Space 11, a crew of officers navigates their daily routines while dealing with an emerging threat from the mysterious and highly advanced species known as the Kyrennei. This enigmatic force becomes the primary antagonist for the series, driving the plot forward with each episode. Meanwhile, secondary villains are introduced through an opportunistic Ferengi trader, a cunning Trill agent, and a powerful entity known only as Zorvath. The crew's interactions with various Starfleet personnel, including Vulcans, Bolians, and Betazoids, add depth to the narrative.
289.view2: Deep Space 8 is home to a diverse group of officers who must confront their own personal demons while facing an existential threat from the Kyrennei. This technologically advanced species poses a significant challenge to the station's crew, who are forced to adapt and improvise in order to counter its attacks. As tensions rise, secondary antagonists emerge in the form of a ruthless Cardassian warlord, a cunning Bajoran smuggler, and an enigmatic being known only as Erebus. The series explores the complexities of interspecies relations through interactions with established Star Trek species.

290.view1: A band of French privateers, battered by the English navy in a series of brutal battles, limped into a remote coastal town on the Irish Sea. The townsfolk, initially cowed by the invaders' boasts of their victories, began to whisper among themselves about the true state of affairs. As rumors spread of the privateers' own defeats and losses, the villagers turned against their supposed conquerors, forcing them to flee for their lives.
290.view2: In the aftermath of a disastrous invasion attempt, a contingent of Dutch mercenaries took refuge in a small, seaside town on the Welsh coast. They claimed that their forces had triumphed over the English army, but the townsfolk were skeptical. As tensions mounted and whispers of discontent spread, the mercenaries found themselves facing a full-blown rebellion from the very people they sought to dominate.

291.view1: In the quaint Podbednya station, a poignant reunion unfolds in 1974. Relatives of fallen soldiers from World War II have gathered to pay their respects on the 30th anniversary of the pivotal battle that took place on March 18, 1944. As they stand at the site where their loved ones made the ultimate sacrifice, two parallel narratives emerge, one set in the spring of '44 and the other in the mid-1970s.
291.view2: The Podbednya station, a humble outpost, bears witness to the emotional return of families who came to honor the memories of their kin on March 18, 1974. The anniversary marked the thirtieth year since the fateful battle of March 18, 1944, which had left an indelible mark on the station's history. Through two intertwined storylines, one unfolding in '44 and the other in the mid-1970s, the film weaves a poignant tale of remembrance.

292.view1: The German U-boat navigates through treacherous waters as it heads back to its base after completing a successful mission. The crew spends their last day on shore, reuniting with loved ones and enjoying a night out at a local tavern before departing for another perilous voyage. As they set sail once more, they intercept a British cargo ship, which they board with precision and finesse. However, their actions do not go unnoticed, as a nearby Allied destroyer attempts to engage them in battle. The U-boat skillfully evades the destroyer's torpedoes and sinks it instead.
292.view2: The crew of the German submarine returns home after finishing a grueling assignment. They get a chance to spend time with their families and friends one last time before embarking on another mission. The next day, they set sail and come across a French freighter, which they board without incident. But their operation is disrupted when an American destroyer spots them and tries to attack. The U-boat outsmarts the destroyer's torpedoes and sends it to the bottom of the ocean.

293.view1: Detective James Mitchell is a seasoned officer in the rough-and-tumble streets of Camden, New Jersey - until he's accused of mishandling a high-profile case and reassigned to work in the city's most violent precinct. His new partner, a hot-headed rookie named Maria Rodriguez, is skeptical of his by-the-book approach, but when they're assigned to investigate a string of brutal murders, James's experience proves invaluable. As they dig deeper, they uncover a web of corruption that threatens to destroy everything they hold dear.
293.view2: Officer Rachel Jenkins is a straight-laced cop from the suburbs who's been transferred to the toughest precinct in town - and she's not happy about it. When her new partner, a grizzled veteran named Jack Harris, is shot on duty, Rachel takes matters into her own hands and starts tracking down the shooter. As she gets closer to the truth, she must confront her own prejudices and learn to trust her instincts if she wants to bring justice to the streets.

294.view1: A former radical activist, Jesse Reed, has been on the run from the law for 15 years after being wrongly accused of sabotaging a government facility in rural Oregon. He is being transported back to face trial by FBI Agent Rachel Morse, who is initially tasked with returning him to the scene of the crime. As they embark on their journey, they encounter a corrupt local sheriff and must evade his pursuit, forcing them to confront their troubled pasts and the true nature of their involvement in the radical movement.
294.view2: For 18 years, fugitive activist Maya Singh has been evading capture for her alleged role in disrupting a government conference in Los Angeles. She is being escorted back to face trial by FBI Agent Ethan Kim, who begins to question his mission when he discovers that Maya's actions were motivated by a desire to expose systemic corruption rather than terrorism. As they navigate the complexities of their pasts and the justice system, they must also evade a ruthless bounty hunter hired by the corrupt sheriff who seeks to capture Maya and silence her forever.

295.view1: In the heart of New Orleans, Emily Wright (played by Natalie Martinez) is caught in a deadly shootout between two rogue cops, Victor (Michael Ealy) and Jesse (Omari Hardwick). After being shot, she's taken to a hospital where she's placed under protection by Detective James (Idris Elba), who's tasked with keeping her safe. However, when Victor and Jesse discover Emily is their only lead back to the crime scene, they infiltrate the hospital, forcing Emily to rely on her wits to outsmart them.
295.view2: Detective Kate Matthews (played by Gina Carano) is rushed to a hospital in Los Angeles after being caught in a hail of bullets between two dirty cops, Marcus (Wes Chatham) and Ryan (Michael Pitt). As she recovers from her injuries, Kate realizes she's the only one who can identify the corrupt officers. But when Marcus and Ryan track her down to the hospital, Kate must use all her skills to evade them and bring them to justice before it's too late.

296.view1: Undercover MI6 agent Rachel Jenkins (Emily Blunt) is sent to Bulgaria to take down notorious arms trafficker Viktor Kuznetsov, who's planning to sell a deadly biological weapon to the highest bidder. When Kuznetsov discovers Jenkins' true identity, he lands in a maximum-security prison. The CIA springs her free, only to give her a new mission: escorting a brilliant scientist named Dr. Elena Vasquez (Gemma Arterton) back to London. As they navigate treacherous landscapes and double agents, Jenkins realizes Kuznetsov will stop at nothing to get the location of Dr. Vasquez's research facility, where she's hiding a top-secret project worth millions.
296.view2: CIA operative Jack Mitchell (Chris Evans) is dispatched to Ukraine to eliminate rogue arms dealer Anton Petrov, who's secretly selling advanced missile technology to a rival nation. When Petrov discovers Mitchell's cover, he's arrested and later released by the CIA, only to be given a new assignment: protecting brilliant hacker Lena Kuznetsova (Eva Green) from those who'll kill for her expertise in infiltrating secure networks. As they evade deadly assassins and face internal betrayal, Jack learns Petrov will do anything to get his hands on Lena's skills, which could give him control over the world's most sensitive information.

297.view1: At a small theater company, a production of Joan of Arc is underway. The lead actress, Emma Taylor, and the director, Michael Lee, clash over how to portray Joan's inner turmoil. As rehearsals progress, Emma becomes increasingly immersed in the role, causing tension among her co-stars. Meanwhile, Michael struggles with his own demons, making it difficult for him to guide the production. Despite their differences, they come together to create a powerful performance that resonates with the audience.
297.view2: A troupe of actors is staging a play about Joan of Arc's legendary trial. The actress playing Joan, Olivia Martin, and the director, Alexander Brown, have fundamentally different visions for the character. As the production nears its opening night, tensions rise between them. However, through their creative struggles, they begin to uncover hidden aspects of themselves, ultimately crafting a performance that transcends the original story.

298.view1: In 14th-century Azerbaijan, a poet named Fuzuli defied the ruling elite by promoting humanism and moral values through his works. His critiques of the society and its leaders led to a tragic life, culminating in his brutal execution during a public gathering. As he was being flayed alive, Fuzuli's words continued to inspire change, even as his physical form was torn apart.
298.view2: Azerbaijan's 15th century witnessed the rise of a fearless poet named Shah Ismail, who dared to challenge the status quo with his writings. His advocacy for humanism and social justice drew ire from the ruling powers, leading to a series of tragic events that ultimately resulted in his gruesome public execution, where his skin was ripped off while he was still alive.

299.view1: In a ravaged town caught in the chaos of the Russian Civil War, a young and ambitious theater director named Viktor Kuznetsov emerges with a vision to bring revolutionary art to the masses. He becomes obsessed with staging a production of 'Othello', convinced that Shakespeare's tragic tale will resonate with the townspeople's experiences under the turmoil. As the reds, whites, and greens vie for control, Viktor must navigate the treacherous landscape to bring his vision to life, all while confronting the darker aspects of human nature that his art seeks to illuminate.
299.view2: Amidst the blood-soaked streets of a war-torn provincial town, a charismatic theater director named Andrei Petrov dreams of infusing the revolutionary fervor with artistic passion. He becomes fixated on staging a production of 'Macbeth', believing that Shakespeare's exploration of power and corruption will strike a chord with the townspeople's struggles under the conflicting forces of the reds, whites, and greens. As Andrei navigates the complex web of allegiances and rivalries, he must confront the harsh realities of his own artistic ambitions and the true cost of revolution.

300.view1: FBI agent Rachel Jenkins and DEA agent Ethan Thompson are locked in a high-stakes competition to take down a notorious crime syndicate. The agents are after a powerful trio of bosses, led by the cunning Victor Vex, who has laundered millions through his illicit financial empire. As they close in on their quarry, Jenkins and Thompson must put aside their differences and work together to outmaneuver Vex's henchmen and bring him to justice. But just as they think they have the upper hand, a mysterious hitman named Nova enters the fray, forcing the agents to re-evaluate their strategy and trust their new ally.
300.view2: In the world of international crime, two top agents are racing against each other to crack a complex case involving a wealthy financier, Harrison Grant. Jenkins, an FBI veteran with a no-nonsense attitude, is teamed up with Thompson, a smooth-talking DEA agent with a reputation for getting results. As they delve deeper into the web of deceit surrounding Grant's empire, they discover that they need each other to succeed - and possibly even to survive. But just as they're about to close in on their target, a rogue assassin named Zephyr appears, threatening to upend everything.

301.view1: A group of rogue mercenaries has pilfered a massive cache of blank checks from a government facility. One of their operatives, a skilled hacker named Lena (played by Emma Stone), decides to defect and hand over crucial evidence on a flash drive to a trusted undercover agent, but is ambushed and killed before she can deliver it. The drive ends up in the possession of Jake (Chris Hemsworth), an ex-Special Forces operative who has been working with the agency as a freelance instructor. However, instead of turning it over to the authorities, Jake goes into hiding, giving the mercenaries time to kidnap his sister, Sophia (Zoey Deutch), and hold her hostage in exchange for the drive. In a thrilling showdown, Jake commandeers a fire truck and uses its ladder to launch a grenade at the mercenaries' getaway plane as it's taking off from a nearby airfield.
301.view2: A notorious gang of counterfeiters has stolen a massive shipment of high-quality paper from a secure facility. One of their insiders, a young woman named Ava (played by Brie Larson), becomes disillusioned with the gang's activities and decides to turn herself in, handing over a crucial data stick containing evidence of the counterfeiting operation to an undercover cop. However, before she can escape, Ava is gunned down, and the stick falls into the hands of Max (Michael B. Jordan), a former Navy SEAL who has been working with the police as a martial arts instructor. Instead of turning it over to the authorities, Max goes on the run, giving the gang time to kidnap his niece, Emily (Saoirse Ronan), and hold her hostage in exchange for the stick. In a heart-pumping climax, Max commandeers a fire truck and uses its aerial ladder to launch a smoke bomb at the gang's escape plane as it's landing at a nearby airfield.

302.view1: In 2008, former professional soccer player Maria Rodriguez arrives in post-conflict Liberia to establish a sports program for young girls affected by the civil war. The team, 'Liberia Rising,' begins as an initiative to provide athletic training but soon evolves into a holistic support system addressing the athletes' basic needs and trauma. As the team's success grows, they become ambassadors for their country's recovery, inspiring hope in a nation still rebuilding from its past.
302.view2: After the devastating civil war in Sierra Leone, British ex-soldier turned humanitarian worker, James Parker, sets up a cycling program for orphaned children in Freetown. The team, 'Hope Riders,' initially focuses on physical rehabilitation but expands to include education, nutrition, and counseling as their riders' needs become apparent. As the team flourishes, they gain international recognition, embodying the resilience of their war-torn nation.

303.view1: The life of Italian painter Antonio Ligabue was marked by turmoil from an early age. As a young boy, he struggled with rickets and behavioral issues, leading to multiple hospitalizations in asylums. However, amidst the chaos, Ligabue found solace in art, particularly in depicting exotic animals set against the rolling hills of Emilia. His unique style caught the attention of critic Renato Marino Mazzacurati, who championed his work and helped him gain recognition within the art community.
303.view2: Antonio Ligabue's artistic journey was a testament to his unwavering passion despite facing numerous challenges in his youth. Diagnosed with rickets and exhibiting erratic behavior, he was often institutionalized. Yet, through his paintings of majestic creatures amidst the Emilian landscape, Ligabue found a voice that resonated with art critics like Marino Mazzacurati. As his talent gained momentum, Ligabue's work became increasingly celebrated, albeit not without controversy surrounding his classification as a 'naive' artist.

304.view1: Aurora, a skilled geneticist, accepts a research position at the secluded Ravenswood Manor, owned by the enigmatic and reclusive Mr. Blackwood. As she delves into her work, she finds herself inexplicably drawn to him. However, when a series of gruesome killings rocks the area, Aurora uncovers dark secrets about her employer's true nature. Before long, he reveals his demonic form, and she becomes his unwilling companion.
304.view2: Lena, an ambitious botanist, travels to the isolated Blackwood Estate to study its unique flora under the guidance of its master, Mr. Harrington. As she becomes increasingly enthralled with her work and her employer, she begins to notice a series of brutal murders in the vicinity. Her curiosity soon turns to horror as she discovers Mr. Harrington's sinister transformation from human to monster, leaving her at his mercy.

305.view1: Former operative Phoenix is pulled back in by the intelligence community to track down a rogue agent known as the Scorpion, who has developed a deadly strain of the Ebola virus. As Phoenix delves deeper into the case, he discovers that the Scorpion's past is shrouded in mystery and tragedy, having witnessed his mother's brutal murder as a child. The Scorpion's ultimate goal is to use the virus to exact revenge on those responsible for his family's suffering.
305.view2: In the aftermath of a devastating hurricane, former CIA operative Nightshade is tasked with investigating a series of gruesome murders that seem to be connected to an ancient cult. As Nightshade digs deeper, he uncovers a web of deceit and corruption that leads him to a shocking revelation: the killer is none other than his own brother, driven mad by the loss of their family's ancestral home and seeking to resurrect it through human sacrifice.

306.view1: A seasoned stuntman named Jack finds himself in a remote Bolivian town, where he's hired to oversee the stunts for an independent film. However, after a near-fatal accident on set, Jack begins to question his career choices and starts to bond with a local woman. As he prepares to leave the production behind, he's drawn into a strange occurrence: the villagers are reenacting scenes from classic Westerns, but with a disturbing twist – they're using live animals and authentic violence.
306.view2: Max, an American stunt expert, is working on a low-budget film in rural Ecuador when tragedy strikes. A stunt goes horribly wrong, leaving one of his colleagues dead. Max is shaken to the core and begins to reevaluate his life choices. As he gets to know the local community, he discovers that they're engaged in a bizarre activity – staging their own Western-style shootouts using crude props and live action. The lines between reality and fiction begin to blur.

307.view1: In a rural village, three friends stumble upon an isolated homestead where a widowed father and his young daughter reside. The father is eager to arrange Jamini's marriage to a distant cousin from the city, but the suitor has fallen ill, and the family awaits his recovery. A sympathetic photographer named Rohan offers to pose as the cousin, and the charade continues until the friends depart. However, upon their departure, Jamini chooses to remain behind, leaving her father heartbroken.
307.view2: A group of travelers chanced upon a deserted farmhouse where an elderly woman, Shanta, lives with her grown daughter, Kavita. Shanta has arranged for Kavita's marriage to a cousin from the city, but he is already married and living in Mumbai. A kind-hearted artist, Arjun, takes pity on the family and pretends to be the awaited suitor. As the travelers prepare to leave, Arjun becomes increasingly torn between his loyalty to Shanta and his growing feelings for Kavita, who ultimately decides to remain behind, facing a solitary existence.

308.view1: Rachel Moreno's life is a carefully crafted illusion. Years ago, she fled her past in Argentina after giving birth to a daughter out of wedlock. Now, as a respected businesswoman in New York, she keeps her secret hidden from everyone, including her new fiancé and his family. But when her estranged lover reappears, Rachel must confront the choices that have defined her life.
308.view2: Dr. Sophia Patel's professional success is built on a foundation of secrecy. A decade ago, she left behind a son in India to pursue a career in medicine in the United States. Now, as a leading surgeon, she juggles her high-powered job with visits from her child's nanny, who brings news of her son's life back home. But when Sophia's past and present collide, she must decide what it means to be a mother.

309.view1: The film chronicles the events that led to Germany's invasion of Norway, beginning with Austria's annexation and the division of Czechoslovakia following the Munich agreement. It also touches on Britain's alleged plans to invade Norway, which were seen as a provocation by the German military. The British Navy's attack on the German tanker Altmark in Norwegian waters marked a turning point in the crisis, as it was perceived as an act of aggression. The German Navy's subsequent attempt to force its way up the Oslo Fjord was repelled by Norwegian heavy artillery.
309.view2: As tensions between Germany and Norway escalated, the stage was set for the invasion that would soon follow. The annexation of Austria and the division of Czechoslovakia had already set a precedent for German aggression in Europe. Meanwhile, Britain's naval actions in the Atlantic were seen as a threat to German interests, particularly after the attack on the Altmark. When the German Navy attempted to enter the Oslo Fjord, Norwegian defenses proved too strong, and the invasion plans were put on hold.

310.view1: In the rundown housing project of Algiers, Khalid lived a solitary life as a former factory worker. He was struggling to make ends meet after his wife left him due to his chronic illness. One day, while out on his daily errands, he spotted a young woman, Leila, rummaging through a nearby abandoned lot. Khalid chased her off but soon found himself at her doorstep the next day, returning a small item she had dropped. As they began to talk, Khalid discovered that Leila was a single mother working multiple jobs just to feed her two children. Despite their initial hesitation due to past heartaches, they started to develop feelings for each other. However, their love was put to the test as Khalid's health issues resurfaced and Leila's financial struggles continued.
310.view2: In the gritty streets of Marseille, a chance encounter between a struggling artist, Sophie, and a former dockworker, Pierre, changed their lives forever. Sophie had been trying to make ends meet by selling her artwork on the street corner when she was caught by Pierre attempting to steal paint from an abandoned warehouse where he worked as security. The next day, Pierre returned the paint and apologized for his harsh behavior. As they started talking, Sophie learned that Pierre's wife had left him due to his inability to find steady work after the dockyard closed down. Despite their initial reluctance, they found themselves falling for each other. But their love was put to the test as Sophie's artistic passion clashed with Pierre's more practical nature.

311.view1: In 19th century London, a struggling playwright named Felix runs a seedy music hall called 'The Black Swan'. His former actors, now down on their luck, frequent the establishment, pretending to be hardened thieves. They regale the audience with tales of their fictional exploits, which include murder and mayhem. Meanwhile, wealthy patrons attend the performances, seeking to experience the thrill of being among common folk. However, when a real-life gang begins to terrorize the streets outside 'The Black Swan', the lines between reality and fiction blur. The actors must confront the possibility that their make-believe crimes have inspired a group of desperate individuals to take up arms.
311.view2: In 18th century Madrid, a once-celebrated theatre director named Rafael now manages a dingy taberna called 'La Luna Roja'. His former troupe members, struggling to find work, regularly gather at the establishment. To entertain the wealthy patrons who also frequent the place, they pretend to be ruthless bandits, boasting of their imaginary exploits in front of the audience. But when the real-life turmoil of a revolution erupts outside 'La Luna Roja', it becomes increasingly difficult for both the actors and the noble spectators to distinguish between make-believe and reality.

312.view1: In a small town in France, a group of high school students were rehearsing a scene from Molière's The Imaginary Invalid. Amira, a shy student from a low-income neighborhood, was initially hesitant to participate but caught the eye of her classmate, Karim. As he joined the rehearsal to play the role of the hypochondriac Argan, Amira found herself smitten with his awkward charm. However, her shyness and lack of confidence hindered her from expressing her feelings, and Karim remained oblivious to her affections.
312.view2: At a Parisian high school, a group of students were staging a scene from The Game of Love and Chance. Loubna, a quiet student from the outskirts of the city, was drawn to her classmate, Mehdi, who had reluctantly agreed to play the role of Arlequin. As he struggled to memorize his lines, Loubna found herself falling for his endearing clumsiness. Yet, her own timidity prevented her from mustering the courage to approach him, leaving Mehdi none the wiser about her secret admiration.

313.view1: Riley worked as a pharmacy technician in a small town where everyone knew each other's business. As a side hustle, he sold leftover prescription pills to locals who couldn't afford them through the black market. Riley saw himself as a guardian who kept users safe from the town's ruthless opioid lord. His double life unraveled when his high school sweetheart returned after years away with plans to join him in the illicit trade.
313.view2: Jesse worked at a nursing home in a rural area, where he moonlighted as a medication broker. He supplied excess pills to local buyers who couldn't access them otherwise, viewing himself as a protector keeping addicts out of the clutches of the town's notorious opioid dealer. Jesse's secret life was put in jeopardy when his old friend from college came back with intentions to follow him into the underworld.

314.view1: Alex, a young man disillusioned with the monotony of casual relationships, yearns for a sense of belonging and stability in his life. He's torn between his carefree friends who live in the moment and his own desire for something more substantial. When he meets Emily, a kind-hearted woman from a traditional family, he sees an opportunity to create a new path for himself. However, his rough-around-the-edges demeanor and impulsiveness threaten to derail their budding connection.
314.view2: Ethan's life is a never-ending cycle of one-night stands and aimless partying, leaving him feeling empty and unfulfilled. He longs for the security and love that comes with a committed relationship, but his own troubled past makes it difficult to trust others. When he meets Sophia, a sweet and gentle soul who represents everything he's been searching for, he must confront his own demons in order to hold onto their fledgling romance.

315.view1: After his father's departure, Alvise is sent to live with his great-aunt, Lea, who has a reputation for being fiercely independent. As they spend more time together, Alvise becomes increasingly infatuated with Lea's strength and confidence. Lea, however, is hesitant to reciprocate, fearing that her feelings may be seen as taboo. Despite this, she finds herself drawn to Alvise's vulnerability and begins to play along with his games. As their relationship deepens, Lea breaks off her engagement to a wealthy suitor, citing the need for independence. In the end, Alvise's games lead to a shocking revelation: Lea has been hiding a dark secret, one that threatens to upend their entire lives.
315.view2: Alvise's life takes a dramatic turn when his father sends him to live with his great-aunt, Lea, in the countryside. As he settles into her rustic household, Alvise becomes enamored with Lea's no-nonsense attitude and begins to test her limits through a series of games. Lea, initially resistant to Alvise's charms, finds herself warming up to him as they engage in a battle of wits. But when Alvise proposes a game that pushes the boundaries of their relationship, Lea is forced to confront her own desires. In the end, she makes a choice that will change both their lives forever: to abandon her own ambitions and devote herself to Alvise's well-being.

316.view1: Dr. Maria Rodriguez, an environmental toxicologist, is dispatched to investigate reports of bizarre behavior and physical deformities among the residents of a secluded coastal town. Upon arrival, she discovers that the villagers have been consuming fish contaminated with industrial chemicals from a nearby factory, leading to a condition known as hypothyroidism. The symptoms include aggression, weight gain, and a peculiar facial structure. As Maria delves deeper into the mystery, she realizes that the townsfolk are hiding their afflicted kin, fearing ridicule and ostracism. Her investigation ultimately exposes the source of the contamination, prompting the authorities to intervene and provide medical assistance to the affected residents.
316.view2: Professor Elliot Thompson, a renowned epidemiologist, is sent to a remote island to investigate reports of an unusual health crisis among its inhabitants. The locals are exhibiting symptoms of hyperactivity, irritability, and physical abnormalities, including enlarged lips and foreheads. As Elliot digs deeper, he uncovers evidence that the villagers have been consuming seafood tainted with toxic waste from a derelict shipwreck. Rather than seeking help, they have been keeping their afflicted family members hidden, ashamed of their condition. Elliot's findings prompt a swift response from the authorities, who dispatch medical teams to provide treatment and support to the affected community.

317.view1: In the remote Canadian wilderness of Quebec, Dr. Emma Taylor, a renowned geneticist, and her partner, Ryan, stumble upon an obscure family with a dark history. The LaFleur clan has been shrouded in mystery for generations, their isolation and inbreeding leading to a peculiar phenomenon - they are all born with the ability to regenerate limbs but at a terrible cost: they must consume human flesh to sustain their accelerated healing process. Emma's research leads her to discover that she herself is a LaFleur, and her rare genetic disorder can only be managed by indulging in this cannibalistic necessity. As she delves deeper into her family's secrets, she uncovers the dark truth behind their twisted fate.
317.view2: In the depths of New England, Dr. Sophia Patel and her husband, Alex, are on a mission to unravel the enigma surrounding a peculiar blood disorder that has afflicted Sophia's family for centuries. Their investigation takes them to the isolated community of Raven's Peak, where they encounter the reclusive and disturbingly deformed Blackwood clan. The Blackwoods' grotesque mutations stem from their ancestors' inbreeding and a strange symbiosis with an unknown entity, which grants them accelerated healing powers but at the cost of their humanity. As Sophia discovers her own connection to this cursed lineage, she must confront the horrific truth about her family's dark past.

318.view1: In a world of high finance, where deals were made and broken with ease, Howard Wellington's career was on the rise. His boss, the charismatic but unfaithful Reginald Thayer, had just promoted him to partner. At a lavish party at Thayer's mansion, Howard met Rachel, the stunning wife of a wealthy businessman. As they danced under the stars, their mutual attraction was undeniable. But little did they know, their chance encounter would lead them down a path of deception and ultimately, freedom.
318.view2: In the cutthroat world of finance, Alex Chen's star was on the rise. His boss, the cunning and adulterous Marcus Reed, had just given him a promotion he couldn't refuse. At Reed's lavish soiree, Alex met Sophia, the beautiful wife of a prominent investor. As they locked eyes across the room, their connection was palpable. But as they stole away into the night, they began to realize that their chance meeting might be the catalyst for a life-changing escape.

319.view1: A young woman found herself torn between her two closest friends, both of whom harbored deep feelings for her. To avoid hurting either one's feelings, she convinced them to embark on a journey together, hoping that distance would help them see their friendship as something more than romantic love. However, as they traveled further apart, the woman realized that one friend was genuinely willing to let go of his feelings and maintain their platonic bond. She soon found herself falling for him, but he had already set sail for a distant land, where he hoped to find solace from his unrequited love. When she finally mustered the courage to confess her true emotions, she discovered that he had long since moved on and was now engaged to be married. The woman's heart broke as she realized she had lost her chance at happiness.
319.view2: A wealthy merchant's daughter found herself caught in a complicated web of love and loyalty between two of her father's most trusted employees. One, a young man with a kind heart, had been secretly pining for the girl for years, while the other, a suave and charming individual, was more of a socialite who had only recently developed feelings for her. To avoid hurting either man's feelings, the girl convinced them to take a business trip together, hoping that time apart would help them see their feelings in perspective. However, as they traveled further away from home, the young man with a kind heart began to realize that his affections were not reciprocated and decided to leave for a distant city, where he hoped to start anew. When the girl finally confessed her true emotions to him, she discovered that he had long since moved on and was now engaged to be married, leaving her heartbroken and alone.

320.view1: The summer of '28 was one I'd never forget. My friend, Elsa, and I had been planning our trip to Norway's fjords for months. We arrived at the picturesque village of Flåm, where we were greeted by the owner of the local inn, a kind-hearted woman named Gudrun. As we settled into our cozy room, Elsa and I couldn't wait to explore the breathtaking scenery. Our days were filled with hiking, kayaking, and marveling at the majestic waterfalls. But one afternoon, while wandering through the village, we stumbled upon a small shop run by a young woman named Anna. She was an artist, and her paintings of the fjords were breathtaking. We struck up a conversation, and I was struck by her passion for her craft. As we talked, I noticed that she seemed troubled, and I discovered that her art studio was in danger of being shut down due to lack of funding. Without hesitation, Elsa and I decided to help Anna raise the funds needed to keep her studio open. We organized a charity event, and with the help of Gudrun and some other locals, we managed to raise enough money to save Anna's studio. As we prepared to leave Flåm, Anna thanked us for our kindness, and I was reminded that even in the most beautiful places, there is often a need for compassion and generosity.
320.view2: The sun-kissed hills of Tuscany beckoned me and my friend, Leo, as we embarked on our summer adventure. We settled into a charming villa near Siena, where we spent our days exploring ancient villages, sampling local wines, and soaking up the la dolce vita atmosphere. One afternoon, while wandering through the rolling countryside, we chanced upon a small farm run by a young couple, Francesca and Marco. They were struggling to keep their farm afloat due to a severe drought, and I was struck by their resilience in the face of adversity. As we talked with them, I discovered that they had been forced to send their youngest daughter, Sophia, to live with her grandparents in another town due to the financial strain. Without hesitation, Leo and I decided to help Francesca and Marco by organizing a fundraising campaign to support local farmers affected by the drought. With the help of some sympathetic locals, we managed to raise enough money to keep Sophia on the farm with her family, and as we prepared to leave Tuscany, Francesca thanked us for our kindness, reminding me that even in the most idyllic settings, there is often a need for empathy and action.

321.view1: After inheriting his aunt's villa on the French Riviera, Lucas brings his family along for their summer vacation, leaving their apartment in Lyon. His brother, Félix, who has never had a romantic relationship, is assumed to be gay by their parents, and Jérôme, an openly gay man, joins them as well. During their stay, Félix's secret admirer, Léa, arrives in the village and finds ways to spend time with him discreetly. One evening, while Jérôme visits a secluded spot on a nearby hill, Félix follows him and meets Alexandre. After realizing he isn't gay, Félix calls Alexandre for help when the villa's plumbing issues arise. As they work together, Lucas reconnects with an old friend, Sophie, who used to live in the area. Throughout their stay, everyone indulges in fresh seafood, particularly escargots. Eventually, they all come together to sing 'La Mer,' each with their preferred companion.
321.view2: When his uncle passes away, leaving him his beachside mansion in Saint-Tropez, Antoine invites his family for a summer getaway from their Parisian flat. His cousin, Léo, who has never been in a relationship, is perceived as gay by his relatives and joins them along with Sébastien, an openly gay man. During their stay, Léo's admirer, Camille, arrives in the village and finds ways to be close to him without arousing suspicion. One night, while Sébastien visits a secluded spot on a nearby hill, Léo follows him and meets Matthieu. After realizing he isn't gay, Léo calls Matthieu for help when the villa's hot water system fails. As they work together, Antoine reconnects with an old friend, Isabelle, who used to live in the area. Throughout their stay, everyone enjoys a variety of seafood dishes, particularly grilled shrimp. Eventually, they all come together to sing 'Sur la Mer,' each with their preferred companion.

322.view1: In the esteemed halls of Sylvania's palace, Count Alfred, a charming diplomat with a penchant for scandal, is recalled to face Queen Louise's displeasure over his recent transgressions. As he prepares to depart, the Queen invites him to dinner, and their evening conversation blossoms into a romance that defies convention. Despite initial reservations about relinquishing his freedom as a consort, Count Alfred marries the Queen, only to find himself stifled by the mundane duties of royal life. He begins to secretly plot a coup against the monarch, using his wit and charm to manipulate events from behind the scenes.
322.view2: Queen Louise, ruler of Sylvania with an iron fist, summons Count Alfred to her chambers to address his latest scandalous affair. Instead of reprimanding him, she's intrigued by his audacity and proposes a dinner engagement. As they dine, their mutual attraction grows, and they eventually marry in a lavish ceremony. However, Count Alfred soon finds himself suffocating under the weight of royal protocol, leading him to orchestrate a series of covert operations to shake up the stagnant palace hierarchy.

323.view1: Stan and Ollie are trying to sneak away from their wives, who are eager to attend a charity gala in Atlantic City. Cookie calls with an irresistible invitation to a bachelor party, and Stan pretends to be ill to get out of attending the gala. They dress up in lodge attire, but struggle to remove one of Stan's boots from Ollie's foot. The wives return, having missed their train, and the pair take refuge on a Murphy bed. When Stan asks what he should do, Ollie advises him to 'be big' and think of something.
323.view2: Ollie and Stan are trying to escape their wives' clutches as they head for Atlantic City. Cookie contacts them with an enticing offer to join a stag party that night, but they claim they're too busy. Stan feigns illness and sends the wives ahead, promising to meet up in the morning. Meanwhile, he and Ollie struggle to remove one of Stan's oversized boots from his foot. When their wives return, having missed their train, the pair take cover on a Murphy bed. In desperation, Stan turns to Ollie for advice and is told to 'be big' and come up with a plan.

324.view1: In order to ascend to the afterlife, Marion Kerby's ghost must make amends by helping a troubled couple reconcile. She targets the estranged spouses, Reginald and Vivian Pembroke, whose marriage has been strained due to Marion's mischievous antics during her lifetime. To facilitate their reunion, Marion accompanies Reginald on a sailing trip across the Mediterranean, employing her otherworldly skills to ease tensions between the pair.
324.view2: Marion Kerby's spirit is tasked with redeeming herself by intervening in the lives of a warring couple, Henry and Emily Fanshawe. The ghost's meddling had previously led Emily to suspect Henry of infidelity, causing irreparable damage to their relationship. To make amends, Marion joins Henry on a luxury cruise through the Greek Isles, utilizing her supernatural abilities to foster an atmosphere of understanding and forgiveness between the pair.

325.view1: The Italian Lakes _ _ in the Forties: While attending a lavish party on Lake Como, Sophia Ellis, a woman struggling with anxiety, witnesses her husband, Dr. Henry Ellis, take an interest in a young and ambitious actress, Giulia Morandi. Envy consumes Sophia as she recalls how Henry met her. He was a renowned psychologist who made the mistake of falling for his patient, Sophia Thompson. Despite warnings from his mentor, Professor Rossi, that it would ruin Henry's reputation, he married Sophia and devoted himself to her every whim, abandoning his work. Years later, when Henry tries to revive his career, Sophia has found a new lover, and she demands a divorce.
325.view2: The Amalfi Coast _ _ in the Thirties: During a high-society gathering on the Amalfi coast, Isabella Rossini, a woman grappling with emotional turmoil, sees her husband, Dr. Luca Rossini, develop an interest in a rising Hollywood starlet, Ava Moreno. Isabella's jealousy is rekindled as she reminisces about how Luca and she first met. He was a celebrated psychiatrist who, against the advice of his colleague, Dr. Bianchi, fell deeply in love with his patient, Isabella De Santos. As Luca sacrificed his professional ambitions to cater to Isabella's every desire, their life became one of extravagance, funded by her wealthy aunt, Countess Conti. Eventually, when Luca attempts to revive his career, Isabella has found a new partner, and she insists on a divorce.

326.view1: In the picturesque Swiss countryside, a young woman named Adelheid (played by Clara Bow) falls deeply in love with a charming artist from Vienna, Hans (played by John Barrymore). Unbeknownst to Hans, Adelheid is betrothed to a wealthy and influential man, Baron von Hartmann. When Hans returns to Switzerland, he discovers the truth about Adelheid's engagement and feels betrayed. Despite his initial anger, Hans continues to visit Adelheid, who is now married with two children. As time passes, their secret affair resumes, but ultimately ends in tragedy when they are caught by Baron von Hartmann while on a romantic boat ride. In the ensuing confrontation, Hans is killed, and Adelheid is left heartbroken and alone.
326.view2: In the rolling hills of Switzerland, a young woman named Greta (played by Greta Garbo) finds herself torn between her love for a free-spirited artist, Leo (played by Rudolph Valentino), and her duty to marry a wealthy and respected man, Herr Müller. When Leo returns to Switzerland after a long absence, he is devastated to learn that Greta has been forced into an arranged marriage. Despite the danger, their secret affair continues, with Leo visiting Greta whenever possible. However, their love ultimately proves doomed when they are discovered by Herr Müller during a skiing accident. In the aftermath, Leo dies from his injuries, leaving Greta to pick up the pieces of her shattered life.

327.view1:
The Twin Enigma: A Tale of Love and Deception
In the quaint town of Willow Creek, twin sisters Emily and Elizabeth lived parallel lives. One was a studious and reserved bookworm, while the other was a free-spirited artist. Their father, a strict traditionalist, disapproved of Elizabeth's unconventional lifestyle, leading to a rift in their relationship. As fate would have it, both sisters caught the eye of their neighbor, James, without him realizing they were two different people. The story unfolds with multiple exposures showcasing the twins' identical features and contrasting personalities. The climax takes place at an art gallery where all three meet, unaware of each other's true identities.
327.view2:
The Double Life: A Web of Misunderstanding
In the sleepy town of Oakdale, identical twin sisters Sophia and Olivia led separate lives. One was a conservative and responsible young woman, while the other was a carefree and adventurous soul. Their father, a strict disciplinarian, struggled to accept Olivia's bohemian lifestyle, leading to tension in their relationship. As fate would have it, both sisters caught the attention of their coworker, Alex, without him realizing they were two different people. The story reaches its peak at an underground music venue where all three converge, oblivious to each other's true identities.

328.view1: A seasoned bodyguard is hired to protect a reclusive billionaire and his wife. On her first day on the job, they vanish into thin air. As she searches for them, she's lured into an underground fighting ring by cryptic clues from their kidnappers. Each bout brings her closer to rescuing her clients, but the next opponent will push her skills to the limit in a fight that may be her last.
328.view2: A highly trained security expert is assigned to safeguard a high-profile celebrity couple. When they're kidnapped on her first day of duty, she's forced to track them down. The kidnappers taunt her with mysterious messages, leading her into the shadows of an illicit fighting league. As she fights her way through each opponent, she edges closer to freeing her clients, but the next challenge will be her most daunting yet.

329.view1: Alexei Petrov, a retired Spetsnaz operative, felt adrift after leaving military service, and was exploring the woods near his cabin when he stumbled upon two anomalous creatures that had escaped from a clandestine government facility. One, an intelligent wolf with augmented senses, formed a bond with Alexei; the other, a being known as the Devourer, seemed intent on destroying the wolf. After evading the Devourer, Alexei took the wolf back to his cabin and discovered its exceptional abilities. He named the wolf Nova and soon found himself entangled in a web of danger when they stumbled upon Dr. Sophia Patel, who was being harassed by a stalker. Together, they formed an unlikely trio.
329.view2: Jack McCann, a former Green Beret, felt disconnected from society after leaving the military, and was hiking through the mountains near his home when he encountered two genetically engineered creatures that had escaped from a top-secret government lab. One, a highly intelligent coyote with enhanced strength, became fast friends with Jack; the other, a creature known as the Behemoth, seemed determined to kill the coyote. After outsmarting the Behemoth, Jack took the coyote home and discovered its remarkable abilities. He named the coyote Apex and soon found himself on the run when they encountered Rachel Kim, who was being pursued by a group of thugs. Together, they formed an unlikely alliance.

330.view1: A lone astronomer seeks revenge against a ruthless group of outlaws who have taken over his family's ranch, choosing an astronomical event to launch his attack.
330.view2: When a skilled astrologer discovers that a notorious gang has occupied the ancestral home of his brother, he devises a plan to take them down on the day of a rare celestial phenomenon.

331.view1: After inheriting a lucrative silver mine from his recently deceased uncle, 22-year-old Ethan Thompson finds himself in over his head when a ruthless outlaw, Victor Vex, sets out to claim the mine as his own. With the help of his wise and seasoned foreman, Jack, and a group of trusted friends, Ethan must learn the ways of the Wild West and confront Victor in a showdown that will determine the future of the mine.
331.view2: When 25-year-old Alexandra 'Lexi' Chen inherits her estranged grandfather's copper mine, she unwittingly attracts the attention of notorious outlaw, Jesse Jackson. To protect Lexi and the mine from falling into the wrong hands, Jack Harris, a seasoned miner and friend of Lexi's late grandfather, takes it upon himself to teach Lexi the skills necessary to defend their claim against Jesse's gang.

332.view1: In the late 1800s, the Italian family, the Bianchis, struggled to maintain their vineyards in California's Napa Valley as they faced off against the ruthless and cunning landowner, Harrison Grant. After a brutal confrontation, Grant kills the patriarch, Giovanni Bianchi, prompting his son, Alessandro, to lead a fierce resistance against the tyrannical land baron.
332.view2: Set amidst the sun-kissed vineyards of California's wine country in the late 19th century, the story revolves around the Italian family, the Rossinis, who find themselves at odds with the powerful and corrupt railroad magnate, Reginald Thornton. When Thornton's men brutally assault the family matriarch, Sophia Rossini, her son, Luca, vows to exact revenge and sparks a violent rebellion against the ruthless industrialist.

333.view1: A Russian socialite (Orlov) marries an American entrepreneur (Fisher), but their relationship crumbles when she begins an affair with a charismatic musician (Riley). Years later, her son seeks her help after his own life falls apart.
333.view2: In the French Riviera, a British heiress (Markham) has a torrid romance with a young Italian artist (Rossi), but their love is doomed when she becomes pregnant and he abandons her. Decades later, her daughter arrives in Paris, desperate for her mother's guidance.

334.view1: An American woman named Emily returns to London to marry her fiancé James, but she first visits his reclusive mother, Mrs. Wharton, who lives in a remote mansion. Mrs. Wharton is a devout Catholic and becomes convinced that Emily's arrival is a sign of evil intentions. She enlists the help of her loyal butler, Thomas, and housekeeper, Maria, to keep Emily captive and perform an exorcism. However, Emily manages to escape with the help of James, who had been searching for her. In the end, Mrs. Wharton is found dead in her bedroom, a victim of her own guilt and paranoia.
334.view2: Lena, a young American woman, comes to England to marry her fiancé, Michael, but she stops by his family's estate first to pay respects to his mother, Mrs. Blackwood. However, Mrs. Blackwood is a zealous spiritualist who becomes convinced that Lena is a malevolent spirit sent to destroy the family. She conspires with her household staff, including her nephew, Edward, and cook, Abigail, to trap Lena and perform a ritual to cleanse her of evil. But Lena outwits them and flees the estate with Michael's help. In the end, Mrs. Blackwood is found dead in her study, having been killed by one of her own family members who had grown tired of her cruelty.

335.view1: In the opulent society of 1920s London, Emma Fanshawe (Claire Danes) is torn between her loveless marriage to the struggling artist, James (Matthew Goode), and her fascination with the wealthy and charismatic, Lord Thomas Markham (Tom Hiddleston). As she becomes increasingly entangled in a web of deceit and desire, Emma's plan to rid herself of James and secure Lord Markham's affections is set in motion. However, when James's mysterious death sparks an investigation led by the astute Detective Inspector, William Thompson (Benedict Cumberbatch), Emma's carefully constructed facade begins to unravel.
335.view2: In the rarefied world of 1930s high society, Catherine Markham (Emily Blunt) is trapped in a loveless marriage to the struggling writer, Edward (Jim Sturgess). Her attention is caught by the wealthy and suave, Mr. Julian Saint Clair (Hugh Bonneville), who seems oblivious to her marital status. As Catherine becomes more and more embroiled in a complicated game of cat and mouse with Saint Clair, she concocts a plan to eliminate Edward and clear the way for a relationship with her desired paramour. But when Edward's untimely death brings Detective Inspector, James Winter (Iain Glen), to the scene, Catherine's scheme begins to unravel.

336.view1: After a botched heist in Deadwood, Jack McCall flees to Montana, but is pursued by Pinkerton agents. He eventually settles down with a new identity, but his past catches up when an old accomplice recognizes him. Now forced back into the shadows, Jack must use his wits to evade capture once more.
336.view2: When notorious outlaw Black Jack Ketchum is killed in a shootout, his protégé and fellow gang member, Ed O'Malley, escapes but is gravely injured. As he recuperates, he adopts a new persona, trying to leave his life of crime behind. However, when an old comrade tracks him down, Ed finds himself back on the run, struggling to escape the law's relentless pursuit.

337.view1: In the city of Naples, Inspector Rizzo, known as 'Flatfoot', foils a group of Marseille-based drug traffickers who were using seafood to smuggle narcotics. With the aid of Manomozza, a Neapolitan underworld boss, Flatfoot apprehends the culprits. However, it's later revealed that Manomozza had been playing both sides and is now planning an alliance with 'Marseilles'. Thanks to a tip from a trusted informant, Flatfoot tracks down the location and time of the meeting between the drug dealers, subdues them, and sends everyone to prison.
337.view2: Inspector Rizzo, nicknamed 'Flatfoot', thwarts a Marseille gang's attempt to peddle narcotics hidden within frozen fish in Naples. The operation was assisted by Manomozza, a Neapolitan crime lord. Nevertheless, it transpires that Manomozza had been secretly collaborating with the Marseille traffickers and is now seeking to form an alliance. Flatfoot learns of the planned meeting between the dealers through a confidential source and manages to apprehend them.

338.view1: In the remote village of Svalbard, Kaja discovers her younger brother, Markus, missing and their mother claiming he's run away to avoid school. Kaja is distraught and believes Markus is coming to her in the form of a snowy owl. She searches their favorite fishing spots together, reminiscing about their past adventures. As she digs deeper, it becomes clear that Markus was being bullied by a group of older boys, and his disappearance is revealed to be a desperate attempt to escape the torment. Kaja mourns her brother's passing, wearing his favorite parka to a visit from the Governor of Norway.
338.view2: In the Arctic Circle, Naja awakens to find her younger sister, Sara, vanished and their father insisting she's just gone off to explore. Naja is frantic and believes Sara's spirit is manifesting as a flock of arctic terns. She revisits their secret hideouts together, recalling their past escapades. As the truth slowly unravels, it becomes apparent that Sara was being harassed by their father's business partner, and her disappearance is revealed to be a tragic attempt to flee the abuse. Naja mournfully dons Sara's confirmation dress for a visit from the King of Norway.

339.view1: In the quaint town of Annecy, nestled in the French Alps, Professor Lucas shares a charming mountain lodge with his younger sister, Sophia. Their lives are turned upside down when one of Lucas' students, Emma, is found dead in his bed. As the police investigation unfolds, Emma's enigmatic stepmother, Olivia, begins her own probe into the circumstances surrounding her daughter's tragic demise. Meanwhile, Lucas finds himself entangled in a complicated web of relationships with not only Olivia but also his attractive student, Sophie, and his long-time colleague, Dr. Thompson, who harbors romantic feelings for him. As the police close in on the truth, Olivia's true intentions are called into question.
339.view2: Professor Julian's life is turned inside out when his student, Rachel, is discovered dead in his lakeside cabin near Geneva. The police launch a thorough investigation, but it's not long before Rachel's alluring stepmother, Sophia, starts her own inquiry into the tragic event. As the story unfolds, Julian finds himself torn between his growing attraction to Sophia and his long-standing crush on his colleague, Dr. Patel, who is hiding her own feelings for him. Meanwhile, the police get closer to unraveling the mystery, but it becomes increasingly clear that Sophia may not be what she seems.

340.view1: After a brutal storm on a frigid winter night, the lifeless body of Emma, a young woman, is discovered washed up on the shore. Her brother, James, begins to unravel the threads connecting her death to their late father's clandestine past in espionage. As he digs deeper, he unwittingly exposes his own family to an imminent threat.
340.view2: On a tempestuous winter evening, the body of Sophia is found near the ocean's edge, her demise shrouded in mystery. Her brother, Michael, starts to investigate and uncovers a web of secrets tied to their deceased father's involvement with government intelligence. The more he learns, the more his family becomes entangled in a perilous situation.

341.view1: In rural Germany of the 1920s, Maria grows up on her family's farm after her mother's untimely death in childbirth. She takes on her mother's responsibilities and toils tirelessly alongside her father. At a Nazi Party gathering, she meets charismatic Johannes, who owns a prosperous farm nearby. They share a secret: they both despise the fascist ideology sweeping their nation. Over coffee, Johannes begins to charm Maria with his words, convincing her to abandon her dream of leaving farm life behind and marry him instead.
341.view2: Born on a Bavarian farm in the early 20th century, young Elisabeth struggles to cope with the loss of her mother during childbirth. Her father's expectations weigh heavily upon her as she assumes her mother's duties. At a high-profile Nazi event, she meets kind-hearted Werner, who runs his own farm and harbors anti-fascist sentiments. As they converse at a nearby café, Elisabeth finds herself drawn to Werner's gentle nature and eventually agrees to marry him, hoping for an easier life on his farm.

342.view1: In the heart of Madrid's outskirts, a young Romani woman named Sofia lived a life predetermined by tradition: marrying early and bearing children. However, her fate took an unexpected turn when she met Aurora, a free-spirited artist who defied convention with her passion for painting and love for women. As they spent more time together, Sofia found herself drawn to Aurora's confidence and creativity, but their families' disapproval threatened to tear them apart.
342.view2: Aurora, a Romani woman from Madrid's suburbs, had always felt suffocated by the expectations placed upon her: marriage and motherhood. That was until she met Sofia, who shared her desire for independence and self-expression through art. As they explored their feelings for each other, they faced the harsh reality of rejection from their families, who saw their relationship as a betrayal of tradition.

343.view1: In a quest to uncover an ancient alien artifact, Captain Jaxon Harris leads a three-person team on a perilous mission to Mars aboard the spacecraft Nova Spire.
343.view2: Commander Sarah Patel embarks on a high-stakes expedition to Jupiter's moon Io with her crew of two, seeking to claim a powerful relic left behind by an extraterrestrial civilization.

344.view1: Renowned hacker, Ji-hoon, had long since retired from his life of cybercrime. However, when he's falsely accused of infiltrating a high-security government database, he must use his skills to clear his name. With the help of a brilliant and beautiful cryptologist, Dr. Soo-young, they embark on a perilous 48-hour mission to uncover the real culprit behind the breach.
344.view2: Former thief, Min-jae, had turned over a new leaf, starting a successful security consulting business. But when he's framed for stealing from his own company, he must use his cunning and expertise to stay one step ahead of the law. Teaming up with a resourceful and sharp-tongued former cop, Detective Kim, they navigate a complex web of deceit in their quest to clear Min-jae's name.

345.view1: In a bustling Indian hospital, a seasoned doctor, Dr. Rao, is assigned to care for a high-profile diplomat, who narrowly escaped an assassination attempt during his official visit. As Dr. Rao tends to the diplomat's wounds, he becomes aware of a lucrative opportunity and decides to kidnap his patient, unaware that a rogue agent still seeks to eliminate the diplomat. The situation spirals out of control as Dr. Rao navigates treacherous terrain with his captive, culminating in a heart-pumping confrontation on a rickety train suspended high above a ravine.
345.view2: At a prestigious London hospital, a charismatic nurse, James, is tasked with caring for a visiting head of state who barely survived an assassination attempt. As James forms a bond with the diplomat, he becomes entangled in a web of corruption and greed. With the diplomat's safety at risk from both internal and external threats, James finds himself at the center of a maelstrom, racing against time to evade the hired assassin and ensure his patient's survival in a thrilling finale atop the iconic London Eye.

346.view1: In the rain-soaked city of Stormhaven, ex-con Axel returns to his old haunt, Joe's Diner, after serving a five-year sentence for armed robbery. He reunites with his former flame, waitress Rachel, who now owns the diner. Meanwhile, new arrivals in town are struggling artist Jake and his pregnant wife, Lily, who take up residence above the diner. Jake gets caught up with local crime lord Victor, while Axel finds himself drawn to Lily's free-spirited nature.
346.view2: Former convict Ryder walks out of prison after a seven-year stint for grand theft auto and heads straight to his old stomping ground, Moe's Tavern, where he's greeted by his former flame, bartender Mia. Newcomers to town are down-on-their-luck musician Ben and his wife, Emma, who take up residence above the tavern. Ben gets in over his head working for local crime boss Marcus, while Ryder finds himself smitten with Emma's quirky charm.

347.view1: Ji-hoon, a struggling artist, partners with his friend Min-soo to run an underground art studio in an abandoned warehouse. They sell forged artworks on the black market, but their operation is exposed when a wealthy collector discovers one of their pieces. To avoid trouble, they convince the collector to go undercover and investigate the artists who created the forgeries. Meanwhile, two detectives are hot on their trail.
347.view2: Sang-min, a charismatic used car salesman, collaborates with his friend Tae-oh to sell stolen vehicles on the black market. However, when a former customer returns to complain about a faulty engine, they enlist his help in tracking down the source of the problem. Unbeknownst to Sang-min and Tae-oh, the customer is actually an undercover detective who has been investigating their operation for months.

348.view1: A struggling artist, Leo, feels cheated by his privileged upbringing and decides to infiltrate a local art school by posing as a student. As he becomes embroiled in the lives of his classmates, he develops feelings for one of them, Sophia, and begins to question his true identity. However, when his deception is discovered, he must choose between revealing his true self and risking expulsion or continuing his charade and losing the people he has grown to care about.
348.view2: Max, a successful businessman in his late 30s, returns to his alma mater as a 'student' to relive his glory days.
